text: Ketika sampai di tempat ini "Bali Mountain Retreat" udaranya yang sangat sejuk menyambut bersama suasananya yang damai tenteram, Tuan rumah yang ramah dan pelayanan yang familiar serasa di rumah sendiri, membuat tidak terasa seminggu menginap di sini terasa kurang.,,, sayang waktu yang terpaksa harus berpindah tempat karena meneruskan pejalanan berikutnya. next... saya pastikan kembali lagi bersama teman- teman saya. tks untuk semua krew Bali Mountain Retreat yang baik... (Recommended)
title: "SUASANA YANG DAMAI,TENTERAM,DENGAN UDARANYA YANG SEJUK"

text: saya menginap di BALI MOUNTAIN RETREAT selama 1 minggu. saya merasa senang karena tempat yang nyaman dan indah, serta stafnya ramah-ramah, dan yang sangat saya suka dari BALI MOUNTAIN RETREAT adalah makanan yang sangat lezat. Terima kasih bali mountain retreat atas pelayanan yang sangat baik kepada saya dan keluarga.
title: Tempat yang indah di pulau yang indah

text: Saya menginap 1 minggu di sini. Hal yang saya suka tempatnya bersih dan nyaman, suasananya tenang, staffnya  ramah-ramah. Yang belum kesini buruan kesini, yang ga mau kesini rugi besar. Dekat juga dengan tempat2 wisata. Makanannya juga enak-enak dan lezat-lezat, makanan yang paling saya suka adalah nasi goreng dan ayam kare. I want go back again.
title: SURGA YANG SULIT DI TINGGALKAN

text: Tempatnya indah sekali,nyaman untuk istirahat .makanannya very nice... staffnya semua ramah.saya sangat  senang sekali mnginap disana.banyak aktivitas yang bs dilakukan disana mulai dari treking,cooking class yang sangat bermanfaat bagi kita,membuat obat tradisional yang bahannya dari alam ,kamarnya tertata dengan rapi, dan bisa juga melakukan kgiatan seperti membuat canang sari,menbuat layang layang..and the end i love bali mountain retreat.
title: Menginap

text:
Saya menginap di Bali Mountain Retreat selama 1 minggu. Satu hal yang saya suka disini adalah tempatnya yang sangat tenang dan nyaman, ini sangat membantu saya merefresh pikiran yang penat dengan tugas kuliah. Fiuuhhhh...
Hal menarik lainnya dari tempat ini adalah suasana pegunungan yang asri, udara yang sejuk, serta riuh suara jangkrik yang saling bersautan di malam hari, mengingatkan saya dengan suasana desa saya dulu. Belum lagi pelayanannya yang ramah dan menyenangkan, semakin membuat tempat ini terasa seperti rumah bagi saya. 
I'd like to come back next year with my girlfriend :D

Ohya makanannya juga enak, favorit saya nasi goreng dan spring roll. Very recomended!
title: tempat terbaik untuk mencari ketenangan.

text: Bali Mountain Retreat sedikit lebih jauh daripada yang aku duga, tapi itu adalah tempat yang sempurna untuk "beristirahat" dari kesibukan Bali, dan nyaman dan sejuk di malam hari. Pemiliknya sangat ramah dan hangat dan memberikan rasa hangat ke tempatnya. Kamarnya bersih dan merupakan gabungan antara tradisi Bali dan kenyamanan modern. Ada banyak pilihan vegetarian pada menu, yang mana tidak saya duga. Tempat ini akan sangat baik untuk meditasi atau retret yoga.
title: Tempat yang indah di pegunungan

text: Setelah melalui kegilaan pantai wisata populer Bali, perjalanan ke ketenangan peristirahatan gunung Bali adalah salah satu keputusan terbaik yang kubuat dalam perjalanan. Resornya merupakan satu kesatuan dari perdamaian murni dan harmonisme di mana pencarian jiwa dan penyelaraskan datang secara alami. Banyak ruang pribadi dan ketika aku merasa lapar atau membutuhkan ditemani, semua kebutuhan saya dipenuhi di sana dengan senyuman besar Bali yang membuatku merasa seperti bagian dari keluarga gunung. Richard, Rani dan semua staf merupakan tuan rumah yang sempurna dan setelah 5 hari di retret saya merasa benar-benar segar berkat jalanan gunung yang penuh dengan nyanyian merdu burung-burung, penemuan candi, makanan yang sempurna, dan teman-teman yang luar biasa, semua ini memberikan saya gairah baru dan dorongan kreatif yang saya butuhkan dan dapatkan dalam melimpah. Pergilah ke sana! Adalah suatu keharusan di dunia ini untuk dapat melepaskan dan merangkul alam dan diri anda sendiri. Anda akan menjadi orang yang berbeda. Ini benar-benar kebahagiaan yang alami!
title: Kedamaian gunung

text: Richard dan Rani dan staf profesional mereka menawarkan kombinasi sempurna dari kedamaian, keindahan, dan ketertarikan untuk membuat pengalaman menginap di sini benar-benar berkesan. Taman-taman subur di sekitar bangunan di kompleks yang tenang dan dirancang dengan penuh perhatian ini mengundang kupu-kupu dan burung, kodok dan ayam. Hidangan yang disiapkan oleh Putri yang pandai memasak dan ramah enak, dan ketenangan yang menyeluruh mendorong kami untuk tidur, makan, membaca, tidur, makan, dan membaca sepanjang hari! Kami juga bersepeda melalui trek hutan dan desa-desa menuju ke mata air panas, sangat menyenangkan. Saya sangat menganjurkan sepotong surga yang sangat indah ini.
title: Sulit untuk meninggalkan sepotong surga ini

text: We stayed for four days in August, we where the only guests which has a bonus , all to ourselves. The rooms are good and comfortable,the view from the tower is stunning at sunrise. The food was good ,limited due to availability and location but fresh, the staff are happy and friendly. Massage is available ( Lucy) gave us a welcome mid strength,which was perfect. Also we walk with a guide to the temple and due to the lack of people had a solo ceremony which was intimate. Yoga is available when they are busy. Enjoy our stay , reasonable price also . Strange it was actually cold some days up in the mountains be prepared.no mossies at all
title: Chilled out

text: Bali Mountain Retreat is hidden away on Mount Batu Kari, one of Bali's holy mountains and major temples. The resort is fully staffed in a beautiful location with a wide selection of room types. They have a full restaurant with a beautiful view. The grounds are lush and well maintained. The staff is helpful and can arrange most anything you may be interested in, from yoga and massage to local sightseeing and trekking. They can even host groups looking for a private retreat.
title: Romantic, quiet getaway with many options

text: This beautiful authentic retreat nestled on the slopes of Mount Batukaru, Bali's second highest mountain, combines local hospitality with traditional style and good home cooking.The views are a million dollar and the tranquillity is a priceless experience well worth the pilgrimage you make to arrive here. Extra activities include spa options, treks to local temples and lessons in making offerings as well as cooking classes. Working to maintain a low eco footprint this is a space for those who care about the planet and who want to experience a deep harmony with Mother Earth. The traditional studio lends it self to groups for yoga, sacred dance, and other arts.
title: Tranquillity, integrity, simplicity, hospitality

photos.caption: Million dollar views ... to the coast on clear days

text: BMR is a beautiful retreat centre that sits under Mt Batukaru. you can feel the spirit of the mountain.  It is a peaceful place the food is good ,  the rooms are vey comfortable and the staff are all so friendly and helpful.  A great place to run or attend a retreat. of just to visit.  beautiful walks and a great place to get involved in Local culture.  i have been there 4 times  and have attend a number of local community and spiritual events .  Highly recommend it.
title: a beautiful place with deep spirit and and wonderful caring staff

text: I stayed at Bali Mountain Retreat for four nights. It was a great place to stay as a solo traveller. The staff were so lovely and helpful, the food in the restaurant was delicious and they were great at catering for dietary requirements, including having lots of vegetarian options. I did two of the tours offered, including a rice field trek and a temple walk. Both were incredible experiences. I was lucky to meet some other guests during my stay who I spent some time with. One of my favourite things was being able to start the morning watching the sunrise over the mountains and doing some yoga in the Yoga Shala (which I often had to myself). Staying up in the mountains in such a unique experience and gives you a real feeling of Balinese life. I could have stayed much longer!
title: A peaceful escape in the mountains

text:
Located in the foot hills of Bali’s second highest mountain “BatuKaru” (height around 2,200m), Bali Mountain Retreat offers a pleasant respite from the pollution and traffic of Kuta.  The resort altitude at approximately 700m means it enjoys a sublime cooler climate than Bali’s coastal towns with day temperatures in the mid-high twenties and night time temperatures around 15-20 degrees celsius. The resort is off older style with an eclectic arrangement of traditional bungalows within the compound; bungalow designs even include some Joglo structures all the way from Java.
As we turned up unannounced and the retreat was not busy we had the choice of rooms and choose a superior room located in a central two story “Teak House” complex which also houses the Yogo Shala on the top floor.
The room was comfortable and featured a huge kingsize bed surround by large mosquito net.  There was a spare day bed and small ensuite which was rustic but functional.  Being in rural Bali you will enjoy sharing the area with a range of birds, lizards, geckos and insects, none of which is anything to worry about.  But if you are use to sterile five star high rise accommodation in the smog, this place is not for you.
We took all our meals at the resort (there are several other options nearby but relatively limited) and the food was exceedingly good.  There is a range of Balinese specialities on the menu plus some regular Indonesian favourites but I strongly recommend the local specialties.
We were lucky one of the owners Anita was present and we enjoyed dining with her.  As an anthropologist, her insights into Balinese life were fascinating.
We took a trek with manager Putu who is also a local farmer.  As we past through the many gardens in the area his commentary proved very insightful into local traditional life.  All the locals we passed with extremely polite and friendly.  We were also impressed how clean the local area was with very little rubbish to detract from the lush rainforest views.
I understand a number of guests come for yoga retreats and certainly the yoga room had impressive views of the local area and even as far as Gunung Agung when the skies where clear.
Very happy to commend this retreat. 5 stars
Thumbs up below if you appreciated this review.
title: Pleasant respite from the pollution and traffic of Kuta

owner_response.text:
Thank you very much for Enjoy and relaxing your stay here at Bali mountain retreat.
Hope can see you again here :)
Bmr and Team
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
More than adequate room in beautiful surroundings.
Our stay at the BMR was a much needed calming and relaxing experience that was not long enough. The welcoming staff were friendly and patient with us during various activities especially our attemps at offering making! Oh how easy that was made to look and how difficult for us to do.
The walk to Pura Munaksari was beautiful and informative followed by a very spiritual ceremony at the temple. Thank you Putu.
We both had wonderful pampering from Lucy who helped me subide into relaxation with her ministrations. 
The food was fantastic as stated in every review. Putri was smiling informative and helpful. Even helped finding a lost watch after hours.
Thank you to the whole team. Our stay was so short and we will certainly be back. Blessings to you all
Judy and Lesley
title: Bali Shangrila

owner_response.text:
Dear Judy
Thank you very much for your good review.
And we are happy you enjoy your stay here at BMR.
Hope we can meet again..:)
Kind Regards
Bmr and Team
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Tucked away under the silently watchful eye of the Batukaru mountain lies this deeply peaceful Bali Mountain Retreat. The retreat which is often used for yoga and trekking activities, turned out to be an excellent location for our student study trip as well. Set in the maintains away from the tourist spots, amongst the local village and staffed by local villagers, It served to be a true local experience. Activities such as rice field and plantation treks, local community volunteering opportunities, visiting local temples and banana leaf picnics are a few of the many things one could indulge in by visiting this place. Special mention to the staff who went out of their way to accommodate our needs. It was a real learning experience for us, an international group of university students from Singapore, India, Indonesia, Germany, Serbia and Australia.
title: Excellent location for our student study trip as well

owner_response.text:
Thank you Vivek! It was really special for Bali Mountain Retreat to host your University Study Trip. All the students were so delightful and thank you for your happy smiles. We loved teaching you about this special area of Bali. A big hello from all staff 😀

Thank you
 Bmr team
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
For those who are looking for a base for hiking and yoga, Bali Mountain Retreat is your place. It is not a luxury placel, but it serves our purposes. We hiked with Putun (a gentle and patient guide) which became one of our best days during this trip, eg. walking among rice fields, swimming in the river, etc.

My kids and I practiced yoga daily in the open and spacious yoga studio, above our Superior room. We had the studio to ourselves everyday. The “Superior” room has 1 king-sized bed, 2 single beds and 1 day bed so our family (parents + 3 kids) could all fit it!

The place is very remote and has no night life, not even a proper supermarket. So be prepared. The weather is a bit chilly for Singaporeans, like 20-25 C so I wish we had packed long PJ’s and pants for kids. Again, the temperature is just perfect for hiking and yoga! Enjoy the place if you decide to go!!
title: A great base for hiking and yoga

text: Bali Mountain Retreat is easily my favourite place on the island. I lived for most of the years 2012-2015 in Ubud, and would visit the Retreat for many weekends. Rich and Rani treated me like family- welcoming, caring and thoughtful. The staff employed there are beautiful Balinese locals, and they work very quietly and efficiently. They also make a huge effort to welcome guests and introduce them to their magical culture. And it really is MAGICAL! The hikes nearby are breathtaking- especially the temple walk. I would stay here time and time again. Thank you so much to everyone at Bali Mountain Retreat. I will see you again soon!
title: Bali Mountain Retreat- a quiet oasis away from the tourist traps

text:
We enjoyed 3 nights in this peaceful and unhurried retreat.
The options- food and massage are in house and of excellent quality; including an informative and enjoyable cooking class.
There are walking excursions of varying degrees of challenge to enjoy the surrounding vegetation and general physical environment- we did the more  leisurely food forest walk- interesting and invigorating.
The quietness and serenity suited our wants and desires- along with our two traveling partners we largely had the Retreat to ourselves ( including the excellent and attentive but not intrusive staff).
One could not escape the sense that in other times and circumstances the focus has and does- but for us it was kick back and relax before the next journey.
Oh and yes there are lots of steps throughout the gardens....
title: Realxed beauty- time and space.

text: Thank you to all the friendly staff at Bali Mountain Retreat for making our two night stay so lovely. The hotel is in such a beautiful location, very remote and peaceful. The food was freshly prepared every day and delicious and the Temple trek organised by the hotel was a really great experience. Would highly recommend!
title: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful location

text: Bali Mountain Retreat is a place close to to my heart. I continue to visit year after year to reconnect with the land and beautiful souls who work and live on the mountain. Rani and all staff make you feel right at home with their kindness and genuinely humble spirits. If you are searching for a peaceful, authentic cultural experience then this is the place! - - - - - - TOP TIP - take a tour guide up the mountain with your friends and learn the delicious flavours of Bali in their super fun cooking class!
title: The True Spirit of Bali

text:
This was my 3rd Retreat at Bali Mountain Retreat and a physically tough Retreat
was planned.  We climbed Mt. Batukaru, Rode bikes down to the beach,visited waterfalls, a river walk and so on. We experienced the traditional Bali and it`s people.Staff were exceptional, always there looking after us.  Food was sensational always fresh and cooked with love. We enjoyed our massages. Thank you to Rani, and her wonderful staff.
title: Fitas Retreat

text:
Wow your retreat exceeded our expectations and the staff were exceptional in making our group feel welcome.  There was nothing that I could fault with the whole experience at the Bali Mountain Retreat.  What ever we needed the staff could assist with.  We plan to run our retreat again next year and will definitely be returning to your beautiful place.   
Thank you so much Rani and friends.
title: What a fantastic week spent at your beautiful retreat

text:
I go back to this amazing retreat center every year.  The set up is awesome to get away from the "often" too much touristy Bali area.  It is out of tourist radar... it is manage by a welcoming woman.  Her staff is so welcoming and awesome!!! 

You feel home rapidly.  Few tours available... trekking to famous Batukaru mountain, bali see temple and ceremony available.  Learn how to make offering!!!  

Food is great as well!!!  Confortable room and mattress.  

Have a massage with Lussy!!!  

Also a wounderful option for group... yoga retreat... gathering or honeymoon gateway!!!

All the best!
title: Real Balinese experience!!!

text: Staff here are so sweet and the owners are very hospitable. Their tour guides provided intimate hikes to the rice patties and hindu termple which is walking distance away. Clean suite with an added bonus of having a fresh thermos of hot water every evening to make delicious espresso ground bali coffee in the morning. Lovely experience in the common dining room where there opportunity to meet and talk to other travellers. The dining room overlooks to canopy and pineapple garden. Fresh ginger tea in the moring was amazing. Be sure to bring your own conditioner as there is onlu a soap dispenser in the shower. My shower was cold and I'm not sure if it was because I was doing something wrong or if it was just cold all the time. Check in regarding hot water before you go.
title: Relaxing with Great Food

text:
My friend and I stayed at BMR for 5 nights (arriving Boxing Day).

We stayed in different rooms, I chose a room with it's own bathroom and my friend without.

I contacted BMR months before our arrival to sort an itinerary for us and Rani was excellent with her communication and arranging it all for us.

We absolutely loved:
* the location, views to fall in love with and the sound of nature to lull the you

* the rooms, the beds were so comfy

* the food, both taste and price

* the general peacefulness of the hotel 

* the staff (Ekah and Putri ... might have spelt them wrong!) we just lovely and a credit to the hotel

* the spa treatments, so so reasonable and an absolute must ... wish I had had more than two!! The reflexology was a good one after a number of days of walking!

* visiting the local rice fields with Goody, he made the trek informative and interesting and gave us a snippet of breathtaking views from secluded parts of the rice fields

I really could go on ...

The only slight negative is the time it takes from and to the airport.  We left at 12pm for our flight at 17:45 and it took until 17:00 to get there are the roads were so busy.  We were really lucky that our flight was delayed, otherwise we would have missed our flight.

All in all ... this hotel is the place to go if you want to get away from it all 😍
title: A little piece of Heaven

text:
If you're looking for a place off the touristy track where you can hike up the mountains through ricefields and to tempels this place is a very priceworthy option.
They picked us up at the airport and the sweet, friendly staff has been very helpful with all our needs throughout our six nights stay.
The room was nice and clean, good comfortable bed, the pillow too big ( well it kind of always is for us)
It's a calm, relaxing place in a beutiful setting and an opportunity to reconnect with yourself.
I recommend Bali Mountain retreat for your next Bali visit.
title: A genuine Bali experience

text: Nice place tucked within lush forest and beautiful garden. A must do place if you are in need of peace and quiet. Food is good. Enjoyed the walk to the terraced rice field. Gede, our guide is very knowledgeable on local plants and culture of the area.
title: Beautiful Place

text:
We stayed in a superior teak house. The rooms are beautifully designed and the beds very comfortable. The semi-outdoor bathroom is lovely and airy (don't understand why people complain about a slug in an outdoor bathroom!).

Wonderful food and delightful staff. A good range of activities to do from the lodge, although just sitting and soaking in the peace and nature can take up a surprising amount of time. 

A real escape from the world. Would go back tomorrow.
title: Divine; peaceful, beautiful and great food and staff

text:
I have just returned from a 6 day yoga retreat held at Bali Mountain Retreat and what an experience it was!! The retreat was invigorating and inspiring, and felt truly life changing. Bali Mountain Retreat could not have been a better location for this journey. Tucked away high in the Bali mountain, this place provides the most authentic, relaxed and dreamy ambience that most Balinese tourists can only dream of. It is a 2 hour car trip from Ubud so if you are planning on staying I suggest doing your research about things to do on the mountain. Or use the trip as a true getaway, where you can escape the hussle and bussle of Bali. During the trip, we became good friends with the staff at Bali Mountain Retreat. They are beautiful people that will make every effort to make your experience here special and unique. 
I will be back!
title: A life changing experience

photos.caption: A wonderful 6 day yoga retreat held at Bali Mountain Retreat!

text: This is an attractive and peaceful little resort, which caters mainly to a young 'discerning' market wanting to explore the surrounding hill-country. Rooms are simple but clean and bathrooms fully functioning. The dining room has a lovely panorama looking out over the trees, and the friendly women that run the retreat cook tasty meals at very reasonable prices. (Beer and wine are available).
title: Peace and tranquility

text:
We stayed here to do some trekking and as a base to explore the region. With hindsight this wasn't a good idea for 2 reasons - firstly the weather stopped us from doing the trek we wanted (OK, not much you can do about that), secondly its location is super isolated, really far from any sights/attractions and the roads are terrible and this made the day trips a little tiresome. There's not much else to do there, but then it's called a Retreat, I suppose the clue is in the name.

The resort itself is nice, our room was spacious but felt a little musty, the place had a rustic feel rather than luxury as we had read on some other reviews, but certainly wasn't bad. The food was very good - especially the breakfast pancakes! The staff were all very friendly and try to be helpful. Overall, I personally wouldn't go back here again, I would stay somewhere more accessible and less basic. However, if you are looking to get away from it all, disappear up into the mountains for a few days and relax, then it's probably the place for you.
title: Rustic resort, nice but not luxury, good food.

text:
The retreat offered everything to make our stay as pleasant as possible. Friendly staff, lovely spacious room, exquisite gardens and excellent food.  We were picked up from our hotel in Ubud and returned three days later feeling relaxed and refreshed.  
Our trek up Mt Batukaru was a highlight; although quite difficult and not for the faint-hearted it was a wonderful experience to see the jungle and forest monkeys, hear numerous birds and learn about the area from our very patient and very fit guide Putu.
title: MOUNTAIN MAGIC

text: This retreat was the perfect end to a two week trip around Bali -- remote, peaceful, scenic and special.  The property offers plenty of unique spaces for writing, yoga and meditation -- where you can enjoy the air, smell the flowers and see the volcano off in the distance. My Lotus Bungalow small house was particularly unique - off on its own with plenty of privacy and an extremely comfortable, mosquito-netted bed.  Sleep with the french doors open and you'll never forget the cleansing breezes of Bali.  Kind owners with super attentive staff -- and great food.  Thank you Richard for a wonderful stay!
title: Private paradise

text: I am very happy to have discovered such a sweet place. The property is beautiful and quiet. The owners are really nice, and the staff is super sweet. Two epic yoga spaces with props are available for guests to use. I really enjoyed the mellow and relaxing pace of Bali Mountain Retreat. I truly had a wonderful time and would recommend BMR to friends in the area. Thank you Richard and Rani for an amazing stay! <3
title: Love this place!

text: Our 4 day stay at the Bali Mountain Retreat was fabulous.  Our room was pleasant, clean, and relaxing.  The surroundings offered treats for the eye at every turn.  The common buildings are stunning Javanese structures, lovingly transported and resurrected, onto the property.  Teak carvings abound.  The landscaping is meticulously wild and beautiful.  The "bird's nest" offers a sweet sunrise view complete with couches and coffee.  The staff are so amazing--they aim to please and cook really wonderful food.  This little piece of paradise is perfect for an intimate retreat--we were there for a writing retreat with 12 participants.  We were able to dine together in a family dining setting--complete with beautiful mountain view and pond.  And we met in an open air building that was gorgeous.  Some of us danced in the yoga studio.  I had a wonderful massage and a really fun hike into the jungle.  This place is a gem.
title: Beauty in the details

text: This is an amazing place to stay in Bali. Quiet, in the mountains, beautiful, with the best hospitality you could imagine. Delicious food. Beautiful accommodation. We learned offering-making, had local girls dance for us, and had a closing fire circle for our group of 10. The place is spacious, laid out over a wide area, and including things like a "bird nest" where you can sit and enjoy the sounds of birds and insects while sipping tea. The ginger/lime/honey tea was so good I'm making it at home! Go there. You won't be sorry!
title: Fabulous Place to Stay in Bali

text: The retreat is located in the nature, far away from all touristy places but it has everything you need to relax, eat well, learn about the Balinese culture and discover the jungle. The retreat sits in a beautifully arranged exotic garden, with small paths connecting the buildings. There is a cosy restaurant with a view over the valleys of the jungle where you can enjoy breakfast, lunch, dinner or have some snacks in between. You will also find places where you can do some yoga. Sometimes they even have some yoga teachers around, but we just did some yoga and stretching by ourselves. Or you can just sit somewhere, look at the beautiful plants of the garden or the jungle and meditate, relax, let the thoughts go. Although the place is very remote (there are just some small villages in that area, no touristy shops etc.), it does not get boring. We stayed for about 10 days and really enjoyed just hanging around, reading, doing nothing, taking lots of massages, going for walks...You could also make some trekking tours into the mountains or book a driver to bring you to Ubud, some beaches, temples or other places you like. Richard, the owner, is a wonderful person and together with his friendly and cheerful staff he will always give you some good advise what to do and organise it for you. We definitively recommend that place!
title: Finding peace, nature and adventures

text: In july we took a group of 12 to the Bali Mt Retreat. When we arrived, the air was cool and sweet, after the smells and heat of the city of Ubud.  Richard greeted us and in minutes we were all in our rooms, with the right luggage already there. Our first meal was cooked by their amazing staff of local residents, it was the most delicious soup I have ever tasted!! Our room was clean and spacious. The activities they offered, a trek to an old temple, trek through the rice fields and their many other offerings were fun and informative. Their guides are so kind and sweet and speak very good english. Or one can just take a walk around the neighborhood without a guide, and be greeted by big smiles and Halo by the residents.  We were treated to a local group of young dancers, their proud parents taking pictures with their iphones, so sweet. The grounds are beautiful, our meeting rooms prefect, especially the dance/yoga space. They even provided a great sound system. What I enjoyed most was the people. Richard, his wife and their staff was like being a guest in a home. They all were sweet, helpful and seemed so happy we were visiting. I highly recommend this space for your own travels or to bring your retreat group. We got to spend 4 nights, I could have stayed longer. Thank you Richard and all your lovely staff for a magical visit, oh and the stars!!!! Have not seen a sky like that for years!!
title: A wonderful place to visit

photos.caption: entrance to dining room, food is great
treated to a local dance group

text: The moment I walked in I felt at home. The grounds are impeccably kept, the staff are wonderful and the rooms are perfect. There was absolutely no fault with this accommodation. All the meals are cooked fresh with local ingredients. The owners are incredible hosts with big hearts and a genuine love and interest for their guests. The staff are so friendly and eager to please, but laid back as well so I always felt comfortable. The room exceeded expectations, very large, clean and private. It was so quiet and lovely. I hiked most days and the massages were amazing. The views are incredible! Cannot fault this place!! You need to go!!
title: Absolute paradise!

text:
If you like staying like in the midst of a jungle, don’t mind going to the bathroom with slugs on the wall, in the sink, and on your toothbrush, and spiders on your doors, and tree frogs jumping into your room, then this place is not too bad for guesthouse or lodge in the mountains. My hubby told me a slug was stuck to my toothbrush and he had to get it off and wash my toothbrush with soap. The toilet is filled with slugs in the evening. 
Many of the reviews we read said the food here was great. But Indonesian food is not new to us and the food here is certainly quite average; very village home-cooked style. The portions were very small and we all felt hungry even after our first dinner. The meals with chicken only had very few slices; perhaps good if here for a diet. 
It takes about 35min to drive up the only road that leads to the retreat. It took 2h to drive here from the airport, and 2h to drive to lovina beach on the north of Bali. The road that came up the mountain was quite broken, especially the last part leading to the retreat. Not so good a location if considering to tour around Bali. I guess people come up to stay up in the mountains. 
We did a trek to the rice fields on our own, and there were many fierce dogs that we had to pass by. Not to mention the road is really not easy to walk on. The villagers are nice and always smiling though. 
The retreat showed pictures of mountain view but we couldn't see it for the three days we were here.
title: Remote stay with slugs and insects

text: This was my absolute favorite place in Bali. The rooms were spotless and the attention to detail exquisite. My room had flowers and a beautifully appointed bath, a porch overlooking the lush scenery. The paths where's wept every morning, and the food was delicious. Every single meal was great and made on the spot. It feels very private, quiet, elegant. Also, the retreat is located at enough of an elevation that there were no mosquitos. Lots of birds! The staff is very kind and attentive.
title: Most Amazing!

text:
We stayed 3 nights on the couples package and were upgraded to the top room for an extra 50k IDR a night. Be aware it seems to be slightly cheaper to book the trekkers package and add on an extra walk separately. The room was huge and lovely but be aware there are big gaps around the doors for bugs to crawl in, and the bathroom had a huge open bit where all sorts of things came in. 

The food was absolutely incredible. Breakfast, lunch and three course dinner were always incredibly fresh, made to order and really big portions we often couldn't finish. 

We did the temple and ricefield walks with the great guide, Grey, which were the highlights of our trip to Bali. We also had a good massage each with Lucy. I was disappointed there was no yoga on while we were there, but with only one other guest, we had the place to ourselves. 

Be aware that this isn't quite the secluded, quiet place I was expecting. There are lots of motorbikes going to local villages so you could always hear one motorbike somewhere in the day. However, this IS Bali, one of the other retreats we looked at was literally nextdoor, and everything else about the retreat made up for it.
title: Great retreat, amazing staff

text: Our stay in Bali Mountain Retreat was really great. Its location is in the middle of the jungle and feels very tranquil. The rooms are spacious with a good bed. We did a walk with one of their guides, which was lovely. No other tourist and a great view of the surrounding rice fields and tropical gardens. The massage was also very good, and on top of that we did a cooking course with a delicious meal as a result! Lovely staff, lovely food: definitely recommend it! You will have a totally different experience of Bali compared with all the touristy places.
title: Wonderful stay in the mountains!

text:
An idyllic place in the foothills of Mt Batukaru. Surrounded by plenty of green, and away from the hustle and bustle of any city life.

Around hotel : a Long quiet street that passes some villages and a couple of other retreats. I went for guided walks on all 3 mornings I was there, and loved this the best. We walked through the padi fields & rice terraces, through the jungle path, and a good walk to the centuries-old temple nearby and back. The temple is a quiet wonder, a simple ceremony was performed, and immediately one feels whole in this environment, up in the hill and surrounded by nature.. I was soaked through in the rain on the way back, completely refreshed and blessed. (Always bring along a small waterproof bag for your valuables and electronics!)

Alas, I dared not walk around on my own, there were just too many dogs around, and some did not look too pleasant. So kind of felt "trapped" but that was okay. There are no shops or restaurants or cafes to walk to, only quiet walks in nature.

Within hotel: The retreat is a small establishment, very cosy and very amenable to guests. Excellent service throughout! 

one has to take all meals at the hotel, which was adequate and quite cheap actually.  But I grew a little tired after a while with the quality, watered down for the western tourists and without the punch & spice one expects from Indonesian cuisine (alas, this is common in all of Bali nowadays)..

The hotel is not sprawling, but there are a few spots where one can sit and enjoy oneself. I wish there were more such spots around the hotel, so that I did not have to stay in the room in the afternoons though (One could go touring in the region though).. 

Surprisingly there were not too many mosquitoes about, or any troublesome insects. The occasional ants crept onto the bed, but that's about it.

Overall, a fine fine establishment!
title: An escape from Kuta, but maybe a trap for some.

text:
Away from it all,  Bali is hard to do if you have mobility issues, but the people are so lovely and helpful you can manage better than I expected

The food here is incredible 

The staff delightful

I stayed in Arjuna,  this is a renovated Javanese style teak house.

These pictures are view from my room

The feeling of being in the jungle and yet to clean and civilized.

I long trek but If you want a retreat experience.  This is a great place to be.  Lovely nearby walks and hikes.  They provide tours on request, and even have a small shop in the dining room for those who want to do a bit of shopping

We were here for a dance retreat and the studio space was very well done

I think I could live here 2 months out of every year!
title: Bali mountain, accessible-ish

text:
All organic food, the accommodation, the massages best I've had in Bali, the trekking thro the rice paddies which was only one of choices. Yoga meditation and general relaxation. 
Would recommend this retreat in a heart beat.
title: The ambience the food the staff.

text:
wow, this place is really a RETREAT. be prepared for a harsh drive to get up to the location, you will be rewarded however with incredible views, tranquility and delicious fresh food prepared just for you. there was also only one or two other parties staying when we did (Mid Feb) so i had the entire yoga platform to myself in the early mornings, was such a great experience meditating with the rain falling on the rainforest leaves.

also be prepared for lots of insects, there are no mosquito nets included in the rooms and there are many openings for critters to come and find you. we asked for a mosquito coil which we placed outside our room before dinner. 

the staff are so accommodating and there is so much to do just from the location itself, i am really sad we did not do the mountain trek as i discovered later that pangolins and other amazing exotic creatures can be seen on it. you can do it yourself, just ask for a map of the self guided tours. we did the jungle temple one which was fabulous. 

this place is such a unique treasure and i will never forget it. thank you.
title: escape into the mountains

text: This hotel has such a great location. The mountains are so quiet. In the morning all you  can hear is the bird chirpping. The breakfast is very local and the rooms, well they're average. The view totally makes up for it though.
title: Super Peaceful

text: The place is very comfortable!.Large and clean rooms! Surroundings are peaceful and breath taking. I have really enjoyed my stay here. Staff is very friendly! Bali mountain retreat is excellent and even more...I definitely would go back !
title: Beautiful!

text: What a blissful experience! The drive up to the retreat was stunning. The rooms were beautiful and clean. Views spectacular. Tranquility sublime! Richard our host was thoughtful and knowledgable.  We were blessed to hear him sing one night which was a definite highlight. If you are looking for peace beauty and tranquility; this is your place.
title: Secret Sanctuary in the Mountains

text:
Our three night stay at Bali Mountain Retreat was more than we expected! The room was beautifully clean and decorated with simple but very stylish class. The bathroom was exceptional in that there was no plumbing smell at all and wonderful hot water from a great shower. The owner has done a brilliant job of melding a sustainable, eco-friendly facility with necessary luxuries - all at a exceptionally reasonable price!
I loved the fact that the staff obviously enjoyed working there - at appropriate times they laughed and enjoyed each other's company, but at all times they were polite, helpful and very astute about how much privacy and quietness guests wanted. 
The food was amazing - we looked forward to every meal and ate every mouthful with delight! We appreciated how they were very aware of diet needs and healthy, organic food whilst not compromising genuine Indonesian cuisine. We absolutely loved this place and have already recommended it to many friends. We will be back as soon as we can!
title: Peace & Tranquility!

text: Clean rooms and friendly, helpful staff, being in the middle of nowhere it was great to have all comforts and amenities available including massage and trekking guide.  Always greeted with a smile and tea service to your room twice a day. Truly lush paradise in the middle of the jungle.... Would go back there anyday!
title: A home away from home in a breathtaking setting

text:
Booked here for my honeymoon getaway and it was awesome, exactly what we are looking for to relax and chill. 

Staff are nice and sweet. Richard was friendly and introduced himself during the first day. 

Tip: book the driver/ airport transfer from Bali Mountain Retreat as Tabanan is it's not a common place the taxi goes and place is up a mountain.  

Go there for a retreat - there is basically no shops nor restaurant nearby. We settled all our meals there and it's nice! 

There are walking tours to keep u busy.
title: Lovely and peaceful stay

text:
I spent almost a week in the Bali mountain retreat doing a yoga retreat with Maria Frisch. It was like a week in Paradise. The rooms are great, the views breathtaking and so are the sounds surrounding the place. Angellike staff, fantastic food and inspiring host. Richard really made a place of freedom here. Good thing he also wants to share it with is. I did not even miss the pool. 
Defenitly Will come back again.
title: Paradise

text: The short drive from the main road is like a bridge from the busyness of Bali to the magnificent silence of the mountains. The road leads you through rice fields and small villages on your way to the retreat. You enter the retreat through the garden, which is beautifully designed by the owner (a great guy from Australia). You can get a little lost in the lush greens of the garden, which is nice. If you are looking to get away from the tourist crowds on Bali, this is the place. An awesome place for yoga and hiking.
title: Retreat owners should check this place out, this is how you do it.

owner_response.text:
Hello Diederick
Thank you so much for your wonderful review, our aim was to share this isolated area of Bali with our guests and you obviously get it.
The wonderful thing about being here is meeting adventurous people from all over and having chats over dinner, guests usually have something in common and often become friends.
It was a pleasure meeting and chatting with you.

Rani and Crew.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We stayed here for 2 nights in December on our way up to Northern Bali. This was the first part of our 3 week stay in Indonesia & the peacefulness was well received.  There isn't much to do here so keep that in mind when booking. We went for a long hike one day & enjoyed the massages at the retreat. We also had an evening dining privately at one of the tree houses with great jungle views.  I can still say that the Indonesian food we had here was the best we had during our entire trip. Richard the host was great & very helpful. 

Thanks BMR! 

Katie & Luke
title: A hidden little gem...

owner_response.text:
Hi Katie and Luke
Great to meet you here on the mountain in Bali. Thank you for your positive review, we are glad you enjoyed your stay here.
We have decided to make available movie nights for our guests for evening entertainment.
Being so far from the tourist areas in a traditional part of Bali is one of the reasons we decided to share this experience.  A break from the hectic southern coastal areas where the real Bali still exists.
Rani and crew from BMR
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We had a lovely time in this secluded retreat. The food was fantastic...some of the best home-cooked Balinese food we have had since living in Bali. 

Richard and his wife are welcoming hosts and very knowledgable about the area. We had some great conversations! Easy walks - and more arduous ones in the area.  And of course, very easy just to lie back,  relax, have massage or two and simply read.
title: Gorgeous small hotel for a get away to the real Bali

text: We stayed at the retreat in October 2015 and had a wonderful time. We stayed on a family package in the superior teak house which was lovely with an enormous bed in the main room and a separate room for the children. The gardens are heavenly with sweet smelling gardenias and bright bougainvillea. The food was a real highlight. Delicious freshly cooked dishes for every meal  that appealed to adults and kids. We did a great guided walk to the local temple. We had to put on sarongs and sashes before going in and they performed a ceremony with incense and flowers and splashed water on our heads and wound a string round our wrists. It was fascinating. Of course a contribution was expected. This is a really wonderful place to stay and our only regret  is that we were not there long enough. Rani, the serene owner is very helpful and friendly and the whole place is very relaxed. Highly recommended.
title: Beautiful and peaceful!

owner_response.text:
Hello Charanjit and Allen
We very much enjoyed your stay with us on the mountain , the girls loved having Daniel and Nathan around, such great kids.
It's so satisfying to see children enjoying nature and being able to amuse themselves.
Enjoyed the chats and contact with people of the same priorities.
We hope to see you again sometime in the future here on the mountain.

Thank you for your wonderful review.

Rani and the crew at BMR.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I so long to go back to Bali mountain retreat! I visited the retreat with my husband in July 2015. We stayed in for 3 nights. Rani and her husband made our stay extremely comfortable. A lovely and helpful couple.  As far as the retreat goes, It's indeed difficult to describe the luxury of closeness to nature that the accommodation provides. Must alnowledge the yummy food that the kitchen staff used to prepare and of course the fun activities like trekking and nature walks through paddy fields that were provided by the team. I don't think I want to write... I just want to go back....

My suggestion, don't miss out on this place!
title: I so miss Bali Mountain Retreat!

owner_response.text:
Hello Aditi
We would love you to come back anytime, it was a pleasure meeting both of you.
It's so gratifying when people understand the true purpose of Bali Mountain Retreat.
Bringing people closer to nature, to see and feel the magic. 
Understanding the need for conservation through the love of nature.

Thank you for your beautiful review, hope to see you again sometime.

Rani and the crew from BMR.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: I wanted to experience staying high up on the balinese mountain so I went tor it. The resort is lovely, lush greenery everywhere, cool air, helpful staff and friendly cats. Rooms are spotless. Food was good but I'm not much of a foodie. I went for the trek to the rice fields and it was a wonderful sight. The retreat is deep in the mountains and the roads are rough especially if you are sitting on a motorbike like I was. Still I enjoyed myself and I think I will return again. The quietness of the place lends it to solitude and reflection, something we can't do much in the hustle and bustle of daily life. At night I felt the moon was so much nearer and I could think and reflect sitting on the verandah. Tomorrow I plan to catch the sunrise since it is East facing from the most well situated verandah.
title: Wonderful cool secluded retreat

owner_response.text:
Hello Eve
Thank you for your review , we appreciate it.
We don't usually get solo travelers from Singapore and I was afraid it may be too quiet for you, however, you obviously enjoyed the relaxation and treks etc. 
We are so fortunate to be high on the mountain where it's cool and clean.
The staff enjoyed meeting you and having some laughs.

Please come back sometime, the road is now fixed and the trip much more comfortable.

All the best from 
Rani and the staff at BMR.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Stayed in the Vishnu & Superior Teak room for 3 nights with 6 pax.

Pros: 
Great weather, very cooling
Friendly staffs and drivers. 
Love the rice fields track, excellence view and not touristy.

Cons:
Approximately 1hr + car ride to the nearest town
Limited food selection in the resort restaurant.
Not much activity to do after the trekking, suggest to bring some books / games along.

Overall: I will visit the resort again for a relaxing trip.
title: Friendly Staff and Good Weather

text:
Stayed for 4 nights in the standard teak room, which had better views and better outdoor seating area than the superior teak rooms. The only difference is that your bathroom is a short walk away and is shared with one or two other rooms (which I never found to be an issue). Personally I felt it to be a better value and would definitley choose the standard room over the superior. 
Most rooms share walls are not well insulted between, so you can hear your neighbors quite easily. The food at the restaurant is great, but the menu is limited- after 4 nights, I felt like we had gone through the whole menu. They also close the restaurant promptly at 8:30pm, so don't expect to do much of anything at night.
title: Great stay- very secluded and relaxing

text:
This place was amazing! We stayed in the newly built Arjuna rooms which were spacious, comfortable and had a beautiful private garden looking over the mountainside. We really enjoyed the food, especially the nasi campur. Putri was wonderful and patient with our many requests and Richard was very interesting to chat to. They helped us organise our onward transfers as well, always with a smile. Definitely one of the high points of the trip. Will definitely be back. 

ps - Getting to BMR could be slightly tricky, so it would probably be best to request transport from the Retreat itself, so the driver is familiar with the route.
title: Lovely place!

text: Had a very pleasant stay here. Food is delicious and very good value. The weather wasn't too great in the afternoons unfortunately when we were there, but highly recommend the rice field / jungle walk in the morning. Massage also very good and affordable. Overall, restful and relaxed but would have been nice to have a few communal deck chairs / more of an open outdoor area somewhere, or some live music or something as was a little quiet-feeling in the evenings.
title: Serene!

text: We booked the trekkers-package which we would highly recommend. One day we went to the local tempel and the other day to the rice fields. Both of these trips where really interessting especially because we were the only tourists around. The highlight of the retreat - next to the stunning location - is the food. We tried to have as many different dishes as possible and were not disappointed once! It was definately the best food we had in Bali. The staff were really lovely and friendly. The room was very nice and the bed was comfortable! The owner, Richard, was also very friendly and chatted to us in the evenings. Also the climate is a nice change as it very clean air and cool in the evenings (jumpers required). One thing to be aware of is that there are not a lot of things to do. There is a lot of time to relax and read etc. The wifi works fine. If went back to Bali we would visit again!!
title: Fantastic get-away in the mountains

text: My husband and I just returned from two magical weeks in Bali. Our first 2 nights were spent at the Bali Mountain Retreat.  It was a wonderful introduction to the island. BMR is a little gem tucked away off a twisty back road on the forested slopes of Mount Batakaru. The landscaping is that of a serene garden, with flowers and statuary interspersed with winding pathways and lovely buildings. We stayed in the newest room, which was gorgeous. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept in, and the mountain air was cool enough to not need an A/C. The open-air dining area was lovely, the food fine, and every staff member we encountered, including the manager, was gracious, kind, and very helpful. Part of its special nature is its remoteness, and so we suggest having the staff transport you to and from the facility, or it may be a bit of a challenge to get there. We highly recommend Bali Mountain Retreat, and would gladly return there, should we be blessed with an opportunity to return to Bali!
title: Beautiful welcome to Bali

text:
We spent three nights in the retreat and found it lovely. The accommodation is very comfortable, open to the fresh mountain breezes and a relaxed atmosphere. They also have several very well behaved house cats, who are more than happy to be patted, but I'm sure they wouldn't be a problem if you're not a cat person. 
They're is plenty of space to relax, exercise or lounge about at the retreat, with my favourite being the bird's nest rooftop sitting area which is rather cosy. 
We also did a cooking class which was fantastic and such a great way to learn some delicious Balinese recipes, and Richard was kind enough to send on one of the recipes to me after leaving the retreat. All the staff were very welcoming, and spoke English (to varying degrees, but always enough to understand one another). 
If you're thinking of going here it's well worth it, but do take one of their drivers, the roads are pretty rough and steep for the last section of the drive. 
We also did a day trip on the way up which we found was a great way to get of see some sights on the way. 
The only downsides of the retreat would be its distance from the main shopping areas or touristy locations, but if that's not really your thing then you will love it. Plus if you want they're very flexible and could probably arrange a car for you for the day. 
Overall we loved it!
title: A beautiful escape

text:
What an amazing location and what amazing staff. Due to a yoga retreat going on we had to book their most expensive and newest room, the Arjuna. However at around $70/night (BB) this room was fabulous. Beautifully decorated, a private garden space outside and huge. The one gripe was that it was across from the kitchen so could get a bit loud.

The location is just beautiful, fresh air, lovely even temperature though a bit cold in the night and early mornings. The food was a bit more expensive than other locations but with the remoteness of the hotel this is to be expected.  The food was however delicious.

The massage was well priced and superbly done. The spa is near the road so the occasional motorbike whizzes by. To be honest the price seemed similar to the prices we saw in ubud at the reputable spas and to me was well worth it.

What really made this location for me however was the staff. Bali I find has some exceptional service levels but Bali Mountain Retreat for me was the best. Putri (I hope I got her name right) was always smiling and went above and beyond anything we expected. Our first night was my wife's birthday and she brought up food and candles in the rain to the Birds Nest, was patient with our inability to chop vegetables during our cooking lesson and helped us organize our transfers. The rest of the staff were as good and Richard was a pleasure to chat to.

I really hope this was the first of many visits and I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know, especially couples looking for a quiet, romantic stay.
title: I'm still missing this place

text: I spend a very good week on bali mountain retreat ! The food and the atmosphère are very good :-) the accomodation are  comfortable ! It's a good place to be peace and quiet and practice yoga in the joglo !and after that eat délicious pancakes .......................
title: Yoga retreat

text: My husband and I stayed here recently and loved it!  The owners, Richard and Rani have done an amazing job with the resort and I really suggest if you need to wind down and want to relax, just read a book and go for beautiful walks, this is your place.  The food is also incredible and the staff are always smiling and very helpful.  One very important tip, please use their drivers to pick you up from wherever you may be and then drop you back.  Taxis get lost and bogged - as another couple staying there experienced.  Putu took us for a beautiful walk through the rainforest and there's nothing better than being surrounded by nature at it's best!  Just book it!
title: Beautiful Bali Mountain

text:
Positives: the resort is absolutely beautiful!   The rooms are really stunning, very stylish and clean. The gardens and surrounding buildings are exceptional and the dining room looking out over the jungle is breathtaking. The massages although double be price of massages at other places in Bali are well worth the money and are very relaxing, in a lovely setting. The female Indonesian staff members were really kind, accommodating and tried their best to make the stay comfortable, and as the room doesn't have a kettle they bring a flask of hot water at night which is nice.
Negatives: firstly the room has open gaps in the wall to the outside, which means after a rainforest shower the mosquitoes are out in force and come into the room at night to eat you alive, only the honeymoon suite has a net and it rains most days, we asked about borrowing a mosquito net and the hotel don't have any so bringing your own is a must. The food although nice was  only average compared to other food we had eaten in Bali. The tours are very expensive and you could almost do the same treks alone. The brochure makes out the guide will be talking you through the local plants/ wildlife etc on the way round although the guide doesn't speak at all, and was too busy speaking his friends to translate what a local was trying to tell us.  However despite the above we would have still given this hotel an amazing review but he thing that spoiled it for us was the manager. On checking out a purchase we had agreed on from the shop was increased in price, we were charged for transport which we had been told we wouldn't be charged for, we were told the card machine had broken and so we needed to pay in cash for our whole visit, we explained that we didn't have the cash as the website and brochure said they had a card machine, so we ended up borrowing the cash from a fellow traveler and then were accused of having the cash the whole time. All in all a pleasant stay ruined by the manager who we felt was only interested in the money from the visitors ( he constantly came to ask us if we had booked treks and massages during he stay- which we had booked 1 massage and 3 treks) he made us and another traveler feel very uneasy, and robbed and gave the impression he could have turned the situation very unpleasant.
title: Beautiful resort shame about the manager

owner_response.text:
Hello Hannah
I rarely respond to reviews as I rarely need to, however, in this case I need to make things clear.
I am the manager and I was not there at the time, you spoke with my husband and I talked about this with him.  He had no idea you were unhappy. 
The cost of the item in the shop was not correct , when the staff rang me they asked for the price and I corrected them.
Food is a personal taste,  most of our guests are very happy with our meals as you will quickly find by reading our reviews.  
Your transport was reduced not free, because it was a share transport, we obviously cannot give you free transport for a 1 1/2 - 2 hour drive.
Since you booked through an agent you did not receive our emails with the payment details and problems with the card machine signal etc. You were told you could pay the driver at an ATM if you preferred. He knew you were borrowing the money so why would he accuse you of having it all the time?
Yes, our massages are twice the price of some of the Kuta spas, however, Lusi is a trained masseuse and we only use good quality oils etc, at USD13 for one hour massage, I don't think it is unreasonable for Bali. 
We always ask guests if they would like to do trek or have a massage, of course.
I'm also sorry you had a mosquito problem , we normally do not have this issue with fans in the rooms, we do have available coils if necessary.
It's  a shame you didn't voice your concerns as our guests happiness with their stay is our priority 
and we do all we can to correct any problems.
Rani Kaal: Manager
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Bali Mountain Retreat is wonderful in every possible way. Simple, well planned rooms, great food and service by smiling staff. Richard and Jani made our stay magical. Transportation was provided from the airport and returned us to Ubud.
title: I want to return

text: This place is a paradise. We Did the 3 night yoga retreat with my mum. The normal instructor was on leave so they arranged for an alternative Jeremy (who was amazing!). The first day guday collected us and took us on a day trip - he was funny and kind, we had a lovely time. Putu took us on a morning hike to a temple and he was extremely knowledgable! We had an amazing massage and some divine food! This place is a sanctuary! I loved it here. The rooms are great and so are Rani, Guday, Putu and the team! They accommodated everything we wanted and all with a smile. Ive come away feeling so peaceful. I highly recommend this place for some real Balinese hospitality. Thankyou! My only negative is that we had to leave!
title: Paradise

text: The Bali Mountain Retreat is a piece of heaven on earth!  The rooms, food, activities, views....  absolutely stunning!!!  The staff are most attentive and always smiling!  Richard and Jani are the best hosts you can imagine!
title: Magical, Amazing Place!

text: Everything about this home away from home was wonderful. The owners and staff are so kind and responsive to any need. The space is quiet and sacred. Beautiful covered spaces to dance, practice yoga or hold a special event in. The food and spa services were wonderful. THANK YOU, Bali Mountain Retreat. I highly recommend!
title: Sacred Getaway with Beautiful Land & People!

text: The staff of Bali Mountain Retreat were caring and took time to get to know us. The center is beautiful and set within the jungle. The center employs local workers. Bali Mountain retreat is set well outside the typical tourist places, and I felt like we had a more "authentic" Bali experience.
title: Lovely Retreat

text: A very peacefull hotel deep in the mountain. Do not expect any activity but rest, fresh air, green plants and the noise of country side at night. If you are looking for excitement, light and loud music just pass your way. If you want peace of mind, walks and nature this is a very good choice !
title: Disconnect there...

text: I stayed a few nights alone at the BMR and enjoyed the peacefulness of the location. It is great to go as group, family, couple escape or as a solo traveler. As solo female, I felt very well taken care of and very safe. The BMR is set near a rural village in the west side of Bali in mountain rainforest. Go on the guided hikes and ask questions. I enjoyed the rainforest and rice field walk (mountain summit not possible during rainy season). The guide was very knowledgeable about the local forest. I particularly valued his passion for the wildlife and knowledge of local birds. The location has a yoga studio for self-practice (if not hosting a yoga retreat) or at times offering a yoga package when an instructor is on sight. Bring novels and leave behind the ones you finish. Good healthy food options using a system to order in advance. I slept so well here. Good internet connection to help me set up the next part of the trip.
title: Quiet, peaceful and beautiful

text:
WOW. This was our favorite part of our trip to Bali. Bali Mountain Retreat is about 2-2.5 hours away from Kuta, and if I ever come back to Bali, this place would be the reason. So peaceful and beautiful. A true getway from the tourism that has taken over Bali. 

The food we had here was the best we had in Bali, which surprised us since it was such a secluded little place! ALL the food was to die for. So flavorful. We will never forget the cucumber sprout basil salad. It was spicy and so fresh! We also had the chicken in coconut milk, ginger lemongrass chicken, coconut pancakes, fried bananas + ice cream. Can't say enough great things about the food here!

I had an amazing 1 hour Balinese massage ($15). So incredible to listen to the wildlife and rain outside while relaxing. 

Our room/bungalow was plenty big (Lotus Room), not that we spent too much time in it. No a/c, outdoor shower which was warm-ish, mosquito net. We didn't see any mosquitos but there are definitely bugs that come out at night (as expected). Wifi was included, but only worked in the restaurant. We didn't even really use it. 

Gorgeous views of the sunrise from a little upper deck area. 

We did the Sari Temple Hike which was fantastic! It was I would say a little more than an "easy" hike, but nothing too intense. We walked at a nice easy pace, but there were some steeper spots on the way back. Shaded in some spots which was nice because it got hot, our hike was from 9:30-12:30. Our guide would pick lots of fruit from the forest and crack it open for us to eat (mini bananas, cacao, snakefruit) and we got to drink water out of a natural spring. She pointed out tea leaves, coffee plants, and there were butterflies everywhere. When we got to the temple, we watched a ceremony, then participated in our own which was a great experience.  

We stayed for only 1 night, which wasn't enough. We would have liked to stay for at least another night, but our itinerary didn't allow it.
title: The most peaceful place I have ever been to

text:
Stayed here for two nights in December 2014. Took the airport pick-up service offered by Bali Mountain retreat. It took about 2 -2.5 hours from airport to the place, due to traffic jam around seminyak/petitenget area.
Approaching the location my husband did worry because it really looked like we were going to a jungle,  because the small bumpy road, rare houses at sight, trees everywhere.. but when we arrived and stayed here the place is really homey, quite modern, well cared, serene and very importantly, no problem with hot water. 
And we got to see some fireflies at the back of the restaurant. Not too many, but enough to make me happy. Was wondering to go walking nearby to do stargazing, but the space in front of the room, good enough to watch the stars above. 
We stayed in the Superior Teak house room. 2 adults, 1 teenager and one 10-year-old child. I did request for 2 extra beds because info stated that the main bed has king size. Turns out the main bed is extra king size, really really wide bed, even wider that the standard king size bed at most hotels. 
Phone signal is not good, but they provide wi-fi all around the place.  We did guided walking to the paddy field, and soak ourselves in the small water stream. One farmer even gave us fresh jackfruit when we walk past him. Love love the experience !! The trekking price is kinda confusing because in the website they state around Rp 300,000 but actually its around Rp 170,000 for around 3 hours walking. So really a good bargain and experience.  
My input for the retreat is only about the food. Since their place is quite far from market, at breakfast time, they asked us to fill down form on what we want to eat for lunch and dinner. The food is quite good but since this is our holiday, we would love to have more food varieties, snacks, side dishes.. may be invest in bigger freezer/refrigerator so allow more varieties especially when we stayed more than one night. 
Thank you Bali Mountain Retreat..
title: Wonderful, serene place !!

text:
I spent 4 days by myself last week at the Bali Mountain Retreat. It is truly a place to relax and soothe the soul. The setting is truly beautiful. All I  needed to do was look out of the window of my bungalow or sit on the verandah of the restaurant to feel at peace.
I also enjoyed a walk to the temple, experienced several relaxing massages and ate delicious food for  very little cost.
It is not luxurious but has everything you could want.
title: Serenity

text:
I have stayed in these retreat for 5 nights in Dec 2014 and it has just been phenomenal during the stay especially the super warm services from the staffs there. 
I was not very used to the flies in the room at first, but after two days, I was quite enjoyed the room and the environment around. 
The room is neat and spacious and the bed is super big. Just the bedsheets may needa change some new ones. 
I love reading books in the "Bird Nest" which is on top of one of the building and you can over see the whole mountain up on there. I had all my meals in the retreat and their food were very delicious. You could see the glow-flies and starry night in the retreat. 
I have walked to the jungle temple and also the rice fields near the retreat. I also have several messages and a hot stone spa in it, Lucy who was the masseur was super good and I enjoyed so much. If I stay a bit longer, I would also join the yoga and cooking session from the retreat. Thank you Buglee who provided excellent services to us and also Richard who is the owner of the retreat. 
I strongly recommend this retreat to all who wants to explore and relax among the nature of Bali! And hopefully Richard and the stuffs there could maintain the retreat and the service as well as it is now :-)
title: A true retreat among the nature of Bali

text: Where do I start.... my first impressions was.. "wow how beautiful the gardens were"... and with the accom rooms dotted around meandering pathways gave it a village atmostphere.  If you are a "foodie" like me you have come to the right place. The kitchen staff will tantalize your every culinary need. A must do is the temple trek, its very authentic experience.  The resort has  Clean water, beautiful rooms, hot showers, perfect temperature up on the mountain. If you are looking to get away from it all... this is the place... its very romantic and tranquil.  I will let you discover the wandering ducks and chickens going for their morning stroll.  I will be back
title: Best holiday  I have ever had

text: From the moment I landed there I felt such a relaxing & welcoming vibe that it was literally minutes & I was writing a song that put a smile on my face. Richard & Rani are lovely, warm & interesting people...they are putting their heart n soul into creating & maintaining a very welcome refuge from hustle bustle land. The staff are a treat, food delicious & you've gotta love the pristine water & freshness of the air...I like that stuff! Clean comfortable room fitted out with attractive decor. Possibly a highlight of my stay was the friendly welcome I received when I attended a ceremony at the local village. BMR... love it!!
title: Perfect place for creative recharge

text: I spent 15 days here and the whole visit was wonderful.  I was met at the airport, driven up to the retreat in a comfortable, air conditioned van, and welcomed personally by the owner, Richard. My room was spacious, very comfortable, and cleaned daily. I had a hot stone massage (2 hours of pure delight) and a one hour massage and both masseuses had the perfect touch. The staff looked after us very well as we were using the facilities to run a course.   The food was authentic Indonesian and they catered to both vegetarians and non-vegetarians effortlessly. We asked for a yoga instructor for the duration of our stay and Richard organised Maria Frisch and we had our daily sessions before breakfast.  I enjoyed the sunrises over the mountains in the distance up in the crow's nest. I would highly recommend this place for anyone running a course as it offers a large room for activities and exercises, the meal times were coordinated with our requirements (including morning & afternoon teas), and the staff were very accommodating. On our days off Richard and the staff were more than happy to assist us with our various outings.  It was sad to leave this little haven as I felt a strong connection with the place and the lovely surrounds.  It is far away from the hustle and bustle of other Bali tourist places so I was able to really connect with nature.
title: Perfect workshop venue: Relaxing, wonderfully attentive staff, delicious food,

photos.caption: Nasi Campur - vegetarian or with chicken

text:
My wife and me spent 6 nights at this beautiful place in October 2014. Our purpose was to escape the mass tourism parts of Bali and instead spend some time in what comes closest to Bail's original rural landscape, native mountain jungles and village life. 

The Bali Mountain Retreat is a very beautiful, quiet place set in lush vegetation perched on the southern slope of Batukaru volcano in west-central Bali far from the beaten tourist track. Only a narrow, partly mountainous road leads there and you need at least 2h from Ubud, 1.5h from Tabanan, and 2h from Denpasar to get there (if traffic is bad, it can be a lot more!).

The retreat itself is largely built of wood and a well-crafted blend of traditional balinese and modern style, and the entire complex is set in lush, dense vegetation - you almost feel like living in a botanical garden. In fact, the slope-setting of the place comes with awesome views towards the south and southeast, and on clear days you can see not only as far as the southern coast of Bali but also the tall volcanoes in the east. We particularly loved an open but roofed, small second-floor-tower room called the "Bird's Nest", from where you can enjoy particularly nice views over the jungle while reading a book.
The rooms are spacious and equipped with beautiful wooden furniture, and the open structure of the building guarantees a constant air flow (the lodge sits at roughly 700m above sea level, so there's no need for aircon and there are also very few mosquitos!). Be aware that ants are everywhere, but that's to be expected in a place like this, so don't leave open food in your room. I should have liked a bit more light in the bathroom, it's a bit dark for shaving...:-)

During our stay, the in-room wifi did not work, but we were told that it normally does. However, there was free wifi in the restaurant area, though obviously not at the high velocities one is used from home.

The lodge has a restaurant with delicious food, though the portions might be a bit small when you come back from a long hiking trip with a wolf's hunger...they also offer the usual spa program including massages, reflexology, facials etc., which (according to my wife) was very high class.
They have some clothes (dresses, T-Shirts, panties) and really beautiful silver jewelery on sale, and at prices about two thirds of what you would pay for similar stuff let's say at the tourist shops at Pura Tanah Lot Temple in southern Bali.

Directly from the doorstep of the lodge, you can set out for hiking and trekking trips through jungle, ricefields and up the slope of Batukaru volcano (including a 2h trek to a small, very seldom visited temple up the slope), which will keep you busy at least 3 days until you'd need a driver to get you to more distant places.

And now to the staff:
I can't say enough positive about the staff at Bali Mountain Retreat. All of them are very, very friendly and while not everybody speaks perfect English, they always try to make you as comfortable as possible and are also very flexible with individual arrangements, be it concerning the food or anything else. The couple who run the lodge, Rani and Richard, are a great source of information and Richard would also come and sit at your dining table for some very interesting conversation, or take the guitar and play some Beatles or Bob Dylan songs on Saturday evening...

We had an emergency situation during our stay that required immediate transport to the next hospital in Tabanan, and without us asking for it, Rani and one of her employees naturally accompanied us to help us with the communication with hospital staff etc. We were very, very grateful for that help and the very friendly and caring support they gave us in this difficult situation!

If we go to Bali again, we'll most certainly lodge again at Bali Mountain Retreat!
title: A beautiful place for nature lovers off the beaten track

photos.caption: A delicious soup accompanied by fresh fruit juice
View from the "Bird's Nest", an excellent place to read a book and relax!
The "Bird's Nest" as seen from the garden
View from "Bird's Nest" over the jungle towards southeast
Bougainvilia in tropical garden of lodge
View from restaurant over the jungle
The building with the Superior Teakhouse Rooms on the ground floor, and yoga space on the second
The building with the Superior Teakhouse Rooms on the ground floor, yoga space on the second

text: Spent 2 weeks at Bali Mountain Retreat and I have to say it was amazing. From the location to the food they serve, everything was excellent. A place I would seriously recommend to friends and family. As I mentioned on the title, it is a truly hidden paradise.
title: Hidden paradise in Bali

text: Stay for a few nights at last in this totally captivating retreat. The gardens are just beautiful, the staff are friendly, helpful and cook great food. Spring water is used so it's clean and safe and you even get to shower in it - a big deal in Bali!!! Richard and Rani and have created a truly wonderful oasis.
title: Oasis in the mountains

text:
Bali Mountain Retreat is one of those places that you suddenly see yourself comparing every other place to after visiting! We started our holiday in Kuta, and the retreat was our second stop. The sheer love for the land that the guides and the hosts have is obvious right from the hotel pickup. 

This is almost the friendliest place on the Island one is likely to visit. The guides are genuine and warm, they love what they do, and are eager to share local trivia. The retreat staff are lovely people - they smile because they want to, and how comfortable you are really matters to them. The owner Richard, who built the resort over a period of 4 years, is well travelled - and has many stories to share over a meal at the community style eating area. We had some insightful conversations with the guests at the retreat, made a few new friends, and really got to unwind, reach inside, and wipe all of the commercial Bali away.

A few words to describe the rooms: spotless, tasteful, comfortable, clean, stylish. We stayed at the Krishna cottage. The way the booking was handled was efficient, the ease with which we could plan our stay sitting all the way in Dubai was surprising, and having our expectations exceeded when we arrived was deeply satisfying. 

We signed up for the 6 hour jungle walk that starts with a trek up the mountainside and ends through lush paddy fields.
