There is something about walking through those forests that gets you very calm on the inside, a sort of comfort to be had knowing that most of the plantlife around you has been there for over 400 years. 

I promised myself that I'd write a review a few weeks after getting back home - just to give a more balanced opinion and not just scribble "take my money now!", so there.
title: Large gulps of tranquil mountain greenery

text: We just spent four wonderful tranquil nights at the Bali Mountain Retreat and it was an incredible experience.  We originally booked a three day package and then added an extra night when other plans were changed.  The owner/management team of Richard and Rani have put together a staff who exemplify Balinese hospitality and congeniality and provide a high level of service.  When I go into the unknown, relying primarily on what someone arranges to have said about their location on their own website, I have learned to expect a degree of disappointment, but at Bali Mountain Retreat, I accused Richard of being guilty of understating the truth about his property.  His response was that he would rather have guests pleasantly surprised rather than harshly disappointed. It is safe to say that the guest will be more than surprised, they will be enthralled.  The hotel and airport transfers were excellent and punctual, the grounds and accommodations lovely, the food delicious. This was an incredible value for the cost.
title: Beyond Expectations in Bali

photos.caption: the studio with the volcano in the background
the traditional Balinese bath is located outside the house
the traditional Balinese toilet is located outside the main portion of the house
the bedroom with an incredibly comfortable bed and a welcoming lotus design of bath linens

text: We arrived around 2am and we were very surprised that Richard got up to show us to our room!  We were up for sunrise and had a scout around in the peace and quiet.  BMR is beautifully laid out with great views over the valley.  There is a lookout room where you can see all the way to Denpassar (in the evening when the city lights are on).  You can also have dinner or drinks in the lookout.  We had a very spacious room (well our own house really!) with veranda looking over the valley, and also a well equipped bathroom.  The bed was HUGE with excellent bedding and ceiling fan.  We didn't really need the fan as it cools down at night and no mosquitos either which was bliss.  We did the daytrip to the temple with another couple.  Our guide was lovely and we were invited to pray and make an offering in the temple.  We were the only tourists there.  There were other daytrips but we decided to relax before heading off on the next leg of our holiday.  The food and service was tasty and local and Richard is an excellent host.  We had some great discussions with him.  It was a very relaxed place to stay at and recharge the batteries and BMR is definitely on our itinerary for our next visit.  We will also book in for more massages - they were fantastic thanks!
title: The perfect way to start a holiday

text: We stayed at the Bali Mountain retreat recently and can say it is tranquility personified in the pure mountain air of Mount Batukaru in Tabanan. A peaceful retreat to experience real Bali life away from the craziness of the tourist strips. The accommodation was impeccable, clean, beautifully designed with attention to quality details and stylishly furnished. The gardens lush. All the water used comes direct from a spring deep within the mountain. We enjoyed the warm hospitality of our generous hosts Richard and Rani. A must journey if you wish to get away from it all to find the space for true contemplation.
title: Far from the madding crowd

text:
BMR is a wonderfull place to stay. Remote location on the foot of Mt. Batukaru in wonderful landscape surround by lush montane (rain) forest. Do not be surprises if its rainy or foggy, this is bali's wettest area.
Ranu, Richard and staff take good care of the resort and of their guest. Food is good and fresh.
Its quite a world away from Kuta and busy city life in general so do not go there if you are in a rush.
We stayed with the family and had a lot of fun doing walks in the area. The downhill bike ride was fantastic. There is probably a lot of good hiking around also outside the hikes that BMR offer.
I cant wait to go back!
title: Beautiful setting

text: We ate the best food in Bali here.  The grounds are perfectly landscaped and maintained, our room (the Lotus House) was gorgeous, the treks were fun and we loved Putu, our guide.  It was a pleasure to spend some time there and see a more authentic Bali.  Don't hesitate to add this to your Bali itinerary.
title: Very pleasant stay

text: The BMR is a wonderful getaway. Completely away from the tourist centers of Kuta, Ubud, or Denpasar, the resort offers a quiet and intimate view of Bali.  The staff provides escellent service with a smile. The TA reviews are on the mark, well-prepared Indonesian food, great views, in a intimate and relaxing setting.
title: Beautiful resort: far from tourists and close to mountains

text: Beautiful mountain property, gorgeously decorated room.  Meals were delicious and plentiful.  Spa treatment was nice, and we liked being able to trek into the rice paddies and bike down the mountain. It is a bit of a trek to get there. If you are a solo traveller, it might feel a bit lonely or you might get a little bored, but if you want to get away from Bali's hustle and bustel, it's a perfect place.
title: Peaceful, nice views

text:
What an amazing place to spend a holiday. BMR gave us our most relaxed holiday ever - we're not young so have had many holidays!
We stayed 11 nights in the Lotus House bungalow which was very private,comfortable,clean and not a mosquito in sight. The staff and the location are second to none, it is not a 5* hotel but BMR offers much much more a real taste of Bali.
The food is nearly all sourced locally and excellently cooked - not fussy or cheffy all prepared and served by such friendly local staff. We were offered alternative meals as our stay was longer than most, a beautifully cooked fish for example.
The organised walks and trips are great fun but it is fairly remote and as others have mentioned the roads are bad, however this has the advantage of keeping most tourists away so lots of peace and quiet.
If you want to experience the real Bali this is the place to come.
title: Wonderful

text:
This is a fantastic out of the way place to relax, unwind and, if so motivated, a perfect retreat for writing, composing... any creative endeavour. There's nothing to interfere with what you want to do, being surrounded by only remote traditional villages and rural life. It is 5 star without the price and food etc is wonderful. Richard (owner and a fine musician) is involved in music creation and collecting traditional music, so you can imagine it is ideal for a complete musical getaway. I loved it!
Phil Manning
www.philmanning.com.au
title: Supreme, sublime and so remote

text:
We were picked up at the airport by a driver - arranged by our host Richard and driven for about 2 hours to the lodge. It was pitch dark and the roads were awful so we were very glad that we didn't have to do the driving ourselves.
On arrival (at about 10pm) it was dark and very quiet, but our hosts immediately made us feel welcome with a flask of hot water for tea and some toast (we were very hungry). 
We woke the next morning to rain but it didn´t matter - breakfast was wonderful - pancakes, fruit and coffee with amazing views over the jungle. 
We were welcomed by Richard and told about the tours that were running that day and we immediately signed up. 
We stayed for 3 nights in this wonderful place. A great place to really unwind. The room was great and spacious (teak room) and the food was fab. The staff are all from the immediate area and are all extremely friendly and helpful. Oh and I can't forget the balinese massage I had - the best one during my trip. :)
All I can say if you want to see a bit of the real Bali, away from the hoards of tourists and see a bit of nature in a place run by really warm and welcoming people then this is the place for you. We will absolutely return. Just trying to figure out when.
title: We loved it and will definitely be back

text: The Bali Mountain Retreat is like heaven on Earth! Nestled in the think plantation of Tabanan, Bali and overlooking the Valley, its truly peace personified! Its a beautiful property with all the modern facilities, including wi fi! The hospitality is nothing like i have seen so far - even the best of properties fail where the hospitality of Bali Mountain Retreat is concerned! Richard and Rani, the owners of the place were great hosts, including the rest of the staff. There was a personal touch in everything there , the stay, the food! The food was great with enough choice, even though the property seems to be so far away from civilization. We loved our stay here and i would recommenf it for everyone trying to get away from the maddening crowd and looking for some tranquility and wishing to get back to nature... get back to life!
title: Amazing!

text:
I booked the bmr on the basis of reviews found on tripadvisor, and we were delighted with the place.

Yes, as some other reviews mention it is out in the middle of nowhere, but that was the best part of it. Halfway up a mountain, no road noise, few mosquitoes, not too many tourists and no people trying to peddle their wares!

The location is beautiful; we took a day trip from sanur on the way, taking in tanah lot, butterfly park, jatiluweh rice fields and batukaru temple. 

We stayed for three nights in the lotus house - I think that was the name- and couldn't have been happier. It was tremendously peaceful and relaxing, and there are a variety of day trips available if you book in advance. 

It was one of the highlights of the honeymoon.

If you're looking for something off the beaten track, peaceful, cleanly, with good hospitality and delicious food then stay here. That was our experience of the place.

Thank you Richard and team
title: Best place we stayed on our honeymoon...

text:
I stayed 4 nights with my family at the mountain retreat "under the vulcano" and we enjoyed it very much!
My parents had a wonderful room in the so called teakhouse and me and my sister had a nice "standard"room too.
Richard and his staff create a personal atmosphere. If you like a (very) quiet, meditative scene, with relaxed people on a beautiful green spot, this is something for you. During the night is so totally quiet (apart from the tokès and tsjik tjaks), that you can hear your hart beating. 
Food  is ok and you can make trips. We did one with bikes downhill to the sea. Underway we met a lot of local people, which are nice and pure.
The trips are little pricy  and it costs a lot of time to reach this spot via a very bad road (which is an event in itself).
And most of the time we were there, it was cloudy and cool (which you can like ar not, we did).  For us it was e good idea to combine this relaxt, remote place with the sun, beach and nightlife afterwards!
Tip: You should aks for the Sweet Beaf, it's delicious.
title: TOP

text:
We stayed here for three nights and it was the complete opposite of the more crowded and bustling Kuta. The buildings are beautiful and the surrounding plant life is rich and soothing. We did a long bike ride to the beach which was very fun and the next day we did a 6 hour trek where we saw much of the local village culture and the unbelievable rice paddies.

The owner Richard and the incredible staff are friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a Bali paradise!
title: It was beautiful and peaceful!

text:
I stayed 3 nights in the rice house, which was very special. The rice house is not very luxury, nor comfortable, but very special and cheap. I can't describe it. You have to go yourself to experience it. The lodge is very clean and in a remote area.
We were very fortunate to be here on a public holiday and Richard took his guests, together with most of his staff to an important temple to experience a holy ceremony. We even got dressed up by the staff before we left. All very exceptional and it makes you forget the long trip to get there.
It's a beautiful area for hiking or just hang around  in one of the great seatings in the lodge. I really recommend this place if you are looking for a quiet place.
title: Very special

text:
Excellent place if you need to have a good rest!! 
We stayed 3 nights in the Teak house room which was furnished with very good taste. The shower and toilets were outside, with warm water, all very clean. 
We just had bad luck with the weather but we managed to do some daily trips to the jungle, coffee fields and temples. 
Richard and his staff were very caring, the atmosphere very peaceful, and the food-local- was excellent. I also had a great massage-the best I ever had!
The only downside was the location. It is far from everything, and it is not possible to rent scooters to explore the area. Thus if you decide to come over, take a rental car!
title: The best of our stay in Bali!

text: The Bali mountain retreat is hard to find and we did get a little lost finding it. In saying that it is one of the features, it is so remote and tranquille. It is a place to find yourself, meditate or simply enjoy the piece and quiete. The food was traditional but good the owners make you feel at home and the local staff will do what they can to help. Fantastic massages and so cheap. I look forward to our next visit with Richard and his lovely wife.
title: An experience to always be remembered

text: Bali Mountain Retreat is utterly magical: there is none of the "make money quickly from tourists" approach that has spoiled much of Bali. Instead there is a clear dedication to doing absolutely  everything as well as possible. If you value quality, this may be the place you've been looking for.
title: A place to find the magic of spirit missing in so much of Bali

photos.caption: view of the gardens and steps up to yoga room

text: Our room was private on lovely grounds, but had no view. Richard was welcoming, but the food was a big disappointment to us, and to the other couple with whom we connected  during our stay. We chose BMR, instead of the Sarinbuana Eco Lodge next door to save money, but there is really no comparison and next time we would chose SEL. The food at Sarinbuana was fabulous (we'll never forget the snake fruit crumble) and it is  much more consciously designed and smoke-free. We had hoped to catch a musical evening at BMR, as mentioned in Frommer's, but it didn't happen. The road to both places is in poor shape, which added an hour round-trip to any daily excursions, but we still used it as a base to travel to Munduk, Lake Bratan, and various temples. We highly recommend our gracious driver, Ketut Sudana at balitransport@aol.com. He is delightful and a wonderful way to experience the best of Bali!
title: Enjoyed It But Would Stay Next Door Next Time

text:
This place is truly touching magic. Great views over the mountains, superb service and lovely rooms for sleeping. The ride to BMR can be a challenge (for me it was fun!!) but the reward is a stunning location. A definitely go for everyone who wants to get away from the huste&bustle of the Kuta area. From BMR you can do great daytrips to Ubud,or hiking the mountain.

The food served at BMR is really nice and good and the proper service needs to be mentioned as well.
title: Amazing location

text:
Nested on the side of Mt Batukuru surrounded by coffee and cacoa plantations is a secret, a secret that needs to be told - Bali Mountain Retreat.

This is where to discover the true Bali.

Set amid gardens containing many exotic plants and stunning butterflies, traditional buildings provide simple yet comfortable accomodation. What more do you need.

This beautiful setting is staffed by local young people who will gladly take care of your needs and share with you many aspects of there culture. During my stay the owner arranged for myself and other guests to attended a ceremony in the village. While walking to the village we were escorted by 2 staff members also attending the event. They proudly explained to us the significants of this ceremony and other traditional practises.  We were warmly welcomed by all and spent a day observing and being part of this beautiful celebration.

 Apart from just relaxing and absorbing you can also go on guided or unguided walks, learn about local farming techniques, crops and traditions. Climb a mountain, ride down a mountain, have a facial/massage or do nothing, the choice is yours.

 Because this is a very rural part of Bali do not expect there to be a resturant , bar or shopping precinct anywhere near. Day trips are available to many parts of the island.

This is a truly beautiful, special place and really worth the journey. I personally will return.
title: Where Bali enters your heart

text:
The management is very helpful to pluck you from the beaches. It is situated in a misty, rainy, green area with cool, fresh air. A great place for solo travelers, as well as couples. The patrons are pleasant, non-intrusive, but friendly. There exist many hours of walking, with a guide or on your won. The hotel fees are comparatively reasonable. The guide fees a bit exorbitant, but after one guided walk, you can figure the lay of the land.

The rooms have a nice, cape-cod, teak wood feel inside and the temperature and night sounds are pleasant. The staff are friendly and helpful, the grounds maintained to ensure conformity with nature and access. 

There are a dearth of rooms with a good veranda - I note only one, but the restaurant and a few other nooks offer some spots of laid back relaxation.

The owner did go out of his way to chat with each guest and one could not deny the perception that the place was actually created for the purpose of pleasure, though one senses economic utopia isn't cracked up for all it was meant to be.

Other than the accidental pool villa near the beach, this was the best and surely would rate very highly on a 3 - 5 day traveler's list of solitude.
title: Quick Retreat from the Beach

text: LOVED staying the the bali mountain reatreat. It is just what someone needs when you drive out fo mad Kuta. Relaxing, peacful, scenic and beautiful. The loveliest and most friendly staff- who are amazing cooks! Food was delicious :) The forests are beautiful. Really just a place where your soul can breath...
title: A magnificent slice of paradise nestled amongst amazing forests.. a place for your soul to breath..

text: Bali Mountain Retreat is an absolute gem, and worth every minute it takes to get to. Located in the fertile volcanic mountainside the plae is surrounded by lush growth in every direction you look - sitting in the restaurant in thce main building all you can see for miles are various shades of green as the coconut trees and banana palms recede into the horizon. It is a peaceful, tranquil and friendly place to get away from the busier parts of Bali (there's no requests for 'looking looking' or 'transport'!) and the quality of the accommodation and food is superb. Richard (the lovely Aussie expat who runs the place) is so friendly and welcoming that you feel at ease as soon as you arrive. And the staff are wonderful - again, super friendly and willing to help out with anything. I was even lucky enough to be invited to the wedding of two of the staff on my first visit there - and incredible experience and one that I'll remember forever. Ultimately I loved the place so much that in my 6 weeks in Bali I had to come back - 3 days wasn't enough! The second time around I stayed in one of the Lumbungs, and I can highly recommend it for any 'budget' traveller!
title: Special place, special people

photos.caption: Taking a walk down the road
The Lumbung where I stayed on my second visit

text:
Bali Mountain Retreat (BMR) is an oasis of natural beauty away from the tourist hubs in Bali.

My husband & I enjoyed five wonderful days here away from the hustle & bustle of our busy lives.

The temperate climate of the mountain area encourage us to do 3 half-day walks – the most spectacular of which was the walk through the village & rice paddy fields.
Even though I was pretty unfit & my husband was recovery from Chronic Fatigue, our guide Putu, who has the patience of a saint, ensured that we paced ourselves & broke our walk with frequent rest stops.

(For the more adventurous & physically fit, there is the 6 to 9 hour mountain hike!)
After our walks in the morning we had relaxing massages in the afternoon, then lazed around contemplating the beautiful views from the various secluded spaces dotted around the centre. Our favourite was the Bird’s Nest from which you can see Denpasar & the mountain tops.

Richard, his wife Rani & the staff at BMR are absolutely lovely. The cliché ‘home away from home’ is actually true here! Nothing is a bother & they went the extra mile to see to our comfort.

We ate like kings & were delighted at how they catered specially for husband’s food restrictions.

We were so impressed with BMR that we’ve decided to facilitate a 6 day 6 night retreat for our clients here later this year. We’ll have the place to ourselves, an exclusive retreat in a beautiful tropical paradise with a temperate climate at a really affordable price!

If you are interested in getting away from the busy-ness of Kuta & Ubud for a few days of rest & relaxation, then BMR is just the place to refresh yourself. We can’t recommend it highly enough.

Michelle (& Bryan)
title: Holiday in Paradise - Best kept secret in Bali

photos.caption: View of the mountain from 'Bird's Nest' at Bali Mountain Retreat

text:
Bali Mountain Retreat is located in a seemingly remote mountainous region of Bali, however surprisingly close to the action of downtown Seminyak! Located on a mountainous ridge overlooking the tropical jungles with views down to the Bukit, BMR is a unique taste of rural life in Bali. Richard the owner is a perfect host with an interesting past full of colour, travels and a life lived fully. The staff he employs are from the local village and are delightful and attentive in that gentle Balinese manner.  The rooms are fresh and clean and well maintained, with free WiFi access and good amenities. All with a rustic mountain style using old teak. A lovely walk that we did was a few hundred metres up the road and down to the right along a well-maintained and paved mountain track to the natural springs. Pools have been built into the river with fresh spring water to cool off in.
I thoroughly recommend when you come to Bali to make the trip up the mountain to BMR and enjoy the peace and quiet! Oh and bring a jacket as it can get chilly up there!
title: At One with the Natural Surroundings.........

text: I can't rate this place enough - one of my favourite places!  The decor of the rooms is stunning, an edge of local flavour but with a modern/western comfort.  The food is delicious.  Richard, the expat who owns the lodge, is a rare find - an owner who cares personally about his guests and also cares for those local people he employs.  THe location is remote enough to experience a different side of Bali yet in reality it is only less than hour up the mountain from the main road.  I'd recommend Richard's driver guides too - knowledgeable and friendly.  One of the drivers even made a return visit to the  lodge for me at night because I had dropped my watch in his car.... such kindness and above the call of duty.  The walks which are organised in the local area are also relaxing and a good opportunity for photos and culture.      TThe massage I had was brilliant -Wow!!! I was lucky to find this place!
title: Wow what a place

text:
The food here was consistently wonderful, and the day trips to the coast by bike, and the rice paddies and Sarinbuana Village, lead by Putu, were fun and interesting. 

One (minor) complaint: the Aussie owner, Richard, has had a career as a folk singer, and in the dining area his CD's are in play at all times, it seems.  Eco-lodge patrons come partly to experience the sights and sounds of nature! -- so give us a break from the constant CDs -- and adding a good gamelan recording to the mix would be welcome.
title: Very comfortable rooms, excellent staff, reasonable rates

text:
We stayed four nights at Bali Mountain Retreat, which we were surprised to learn is literally next door to Sarinbuana Eco-Lodge. The first three nights we stayed in their most expensive room -- the Lotus House -- but in the Teak House for the final night (since it had already been booked when we booked). The Lotus House is more in the rainforest and the sheets felt wet at night from the humidity, although the air was cool. The Lotus House has a mini-bar but not the Teak House (although the Teak House had a few advantages). The Lotus House was more private since off to itself, while the Teak House includes several rooms.

The hotel has people on staff who may be hired for trekking. We did a mountain to sea cycling trip and a village/rice paddy walk (which was slippery since much rain had fallen). Both treks were great and our guide Putu was wonderful. One day we set off on our own and hiked through the lush rainforest up Mt. Batukaru, at least as far as the temple. The menu is limited but the food was as good as any we ate in Bali. One night we ate next door at Sarinbuana -- their food was comparable but a bit more expensive.
title: Lovely base for exploring Mt. Batukaru rainforest area

text: Hidden away on the mountain slope this relaxing spot in a very beautiful garden is very unique on Bali away from the tourists. The rooms are very stylish with everything made from teak wood and with 2 kids it was very nice with option of extra 2 seperate beds in the room. Great places to hang out and relax which was all we where doing while we stayd there. Richard (the Australian owner) was very helpful and present and did also arrange our transfer. Award yourself while on Bali to stay here to enjoy something very special compared to more wellknown places on Bali.
title: Beautiful Cozy Hideaway from Bali´s tourist places

text: What an amazing place Richard has created on the slopes of Mt Batukora.  We stayed four nights in this special place. Highly recommend BMR, a truely spiritual place to visit.... thank you Richard and your lovely helpers.
title: Magical place in the mountains

text: I stayed at BMR for four nights. I had originally booked for eleven but as a solo traveller I realised quite soon after arrival that this was going to be far too long as the retreat is very isolated (the bad weather at the time also played a big part in me leaving early). However, that aside, the retreat is a beautiful place to stay and the owner Richard is extremely helpful and welcoming. He upgraded me on arrival as he had a spare room (I was originally booked for a rice house) and I could see throughout my stay that he looks after his guests exceptionally well. The restaurant food is outstanding in terms of value, quality and presentation and eating there was an absolute pleasure. The staff are incredibly friendly, polite and helpful and look after you very well without being overbearing. The only things that were slightly annoying was the shared outside bathroom/toilet was a bit of a pain to go to in the middle of the night and the soundproofing between rooms isn't great. There is a great yoga/dance studio though and I was able to practice yoga there each day. If you're a solo traveller then one or two nights here would be plenty but if you're a couple then a longer stay would be fine. There are walks and excursions available and massage treatments (I recommend the reflexology, head, neck and shoulder massage). All in all a really great place to stay with beautiful furnishings and an amazing team. If you want to get away from it all for a bit then this is the place to stay.
title: Beautiful retreat and fantastic staff

text:
I would highly recommend Bali Mountain Retreat, especially for nature lovers, those who are interested in seeing more of bali than the touristy areas and those who are keen to do some hiking.
I found the accommodation to be lovely. Richard (owner) very kindly upgraded us from the rice huts to the budget teak house rooms (share bathroom) at a very reasonable rate due to the recent heavy rain falls (he thought we would be more comfortable in the teak house room).  We found this room to be great - lovely king size bed, doors opening onto what felt like our own little part of the jungle. 
The most striking thing about Bali Mountain Retreat is the beautiful gardens. We saw many flowering orchids and beautiful heliconias. There are also many parts in Bali Mountain Retreat to relax with a good book - most also having great views down towards denpasar and the beaches. 
We opted to do the 6hr trek which involved a few hours climbing up the mountain in the jungle and a few hours exploring the rice fields. The latter was definately a highlight of our trip. we met lovely locals and enjoyed seeing the rich farming area and cooling our feet in a beautiful flowing stream .
The food at BMR is fantastic. I couldn’t believe that in the middle of our mountain trek we were served hot nasi goreng at the temple, complete with still-runny fried egg. Amazing! Also, don’t miss the eggplant wedges and fern tip spring rolls at the BMR restaurant
title: A little piece of paradise!

text:
For our first time in Bali and our second night after a short stop in Senur, arriving at Bali Mountain Retreat after a long bumpy ride (with a taxi who didn't know the way!) was an absolute pleasure. Richard, our host, was the ultimate host - patient, friendly, knowledgeable and really just a lovely person. We stayed for 3 nights in a teak house room. The room was beautifully designed with the right mix of luxury and simplicity. The detail in the service of the room was fantastic - for example, a jug of drinking water, urn of hot water, both refilled daily. The room was clean, spacious and very comfortable. The food was delicious - fresh produce and made with love. Each meal was made to order and was the perfect mix of Balinese and Western fusion. The staff at BMR are all genuinely delightful. The other guests were also great - like minded people and a true reflection on what BMR is about - care for nature, the environment, and people's wellbeing. The area is remote and tourism free. We did the 25km cycle tour from BMR down the mountain to the sea. This was truly a highlight for us - we rode through villages and rice paddies and saw smiling faces and farmers working in their beautiful fields. It was spectacular.
We also had a massage at BMR which was also great and walked up the steep road to the temple. 
We look forward to Richard building a pool by our next visit - hint, hint. 
This place is special.
title: A special place

text:
Our trip to BMR commenced with the prearranged pickup from Legian. The driver was absolutely fantastic and provided as much detail as a tour guide as we asked on our way to the BMR getaway. The 2 1/2 hour drive up the mountains was through the local villages and over very slow and potholed paths (roads).

Lunch was provided in the restaurant when we asked on arrival. Like all the food that we ate while at BMR the food was fresh, local and extremely tasty.  We mainly ate vegetarian and after three nights we had eaten all the choices in the menu.

The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and also provided our romantic dinner in the BirdsNest exceptionally on our last night.

The facilities, rooms and location were all clean and were all very airy and spacious and would be well suited for a romantic getaway or group retreat.  We generally relaxed (and ate) while we stayed at BMR. The gardens are maintained with lots of colour and variety and plenty of vegetables and fruits growing. The local tour guides provided us with some great walks and insights to their villages  local areas including the local temple at Mount Batukaru.

We would definitely like to visit and stay again. :)
title: Relaxing escape in a traditional Balinese setting up high in the mountains

photos.caption: A local walk to the rice fields

text:
We spent two nights here on a 5 night visit to Bali. The owners and staff were very warm and welcoming. The rooms are big and done up with style and taste. The oversized king bed was a nice surprise and it was also very comfortable which can be hit or miss in Bali in this price range. The food was imaginative, tasty and varied the wireless internet was fast and reliable and we took advantage of the many areas to relax and unwind. We did not take advantage of any of the hikes or day outings so I cannot comment on them. 

During our stay, we wandered over to Sarin Buana to have a look  which is a short walk away. We asked to have a look around and the woman (wife of the owner) said they were full. She was very rude and basically treated us like trespassers when we wanted to have a look around. I understand the need for privacy for paying guests and with the hotel full, I did not expect to be shown a room, but in the 15 years I've been coming to Bali, never have I been refused an offer to have a look around any hotel, resort or guesthouse as a future potential customer. And the location is so far off the beaten path, there is certainly no risk of hords of curious tourists wandering through the place. From what we did see however (the common area and monkey's in a small cage), there was no comparison; the Bali Mountain Retreat has it beat by a long shot.
title: Superb Experience Off the Beaten Path

text:
After some time in Kuta, Sanur and Ubud, we made the trek up to Mt Batakaru. Looking to find a different view of Bali - we were not disappointed by the Bali Mountain Retreat (literally and metaphorically). It took us about an hour and a half to get there from Sanur, but it was worth the trip. The retreat's driver came and picked us up, and happily chatted with us and played a selection of CDs on the way (Guns N Roses, anyone?)

When we got to the retreat, we were greeted by owners Richard and Rebecca, who were friendly, helpful and hospitable. They showed us to our room, which was clean and beautifully laid out. The bathroom had a small gap between the wall and the roof, which gave it a nice open air feeling.

We were also lucky enough to be at the retreat for one of their famed music nights, which happen once a month. There they put on a gorgeous buffet of traditional indonesian foods, and all the guests came together for a night of music under the stars. Perfect.

If you're looking for somewhere quiet, beautiful and where you're well cared for, then this is the place for you!
title: Beautiful - a very different Bali

text: Nestled amongst cocoa & coffee plantations Bali Mountain Retreat is a an experience you will never forget.  It's not your typical place to stay.  It's a place where you get a feel of the real Bali.  Richard and Rebecca make it feel like you are staying with family.  We loved the architecture of the buildings that Richard spent 4 years restoring.  The food was top class and some dishes were so popular, they ran out.  They have a really nice hall with teak wood floors above the rooms to do yoga with lots of fresh air and a great view.  Our visit coincided with Richard's monthly concert which was an added treat.  The various activities (recommend taking the rice paddy trek) guided by their local Balinese staff are unique and worth doing.  The only downside (not really though, as it keeps the hordes of tourists out) is that the access to the retreat requires travel over some difficult roads.  It is important to plan/coordinate with Richard or Rebecca before travel. .  Do not miss out on the Balinese massage in the music room.
title: Stairway to heaven

photos.caption: Richard Kaal is fantastic on the guitar

text: Excellent location in a relatively secluded less touristy part of Bali. Food and accommodation were good. Guides went the extra mile to help us during our G. Batukaru trek - thanks a million, Putuh and Gede!
title: Only a dash of tourism

photos.caption: upstairs of Teakhouse is a dance studio

text: This place was a total find - the location is stunning (albeit reached via a very bumpy uncomfortable road)and very chilled , the rooms were beautifully decorated with lovely semi-outside bathrooms. The staff were great - the cook (james) was from New Zealand and was adept at turning the contents of the organic garden into very tasty meals - Stephanie (from Ireland)- who was working there at the time was lovely and really helpful. You can do great guided tours from here - we went on a walk in the padi fields with a local guy - and this really was a trip highlight. We were the only pones staying here at the time - it was fully booked out the following week, it may well have been a little too crowded when full - but for us it represented excelled value for money and comes highly recommended!!
title: this is the place to come to find the real Bali

text:
This place is in the middle of nowhere. You wont be able to find it yourself so make sure to use the resort pick-up service.

But once you get here it certainly is lovely. Fantastic views across hills, fields, plains and all the way down to the sea!! The rooms are spotlessly clean but I recommend the converted Lumbung (rice-silo) for a very different kind of stay. 

The food is great and the concert that Richard can be convinced (rather easily...heheh) to give is simply fantastic. See if they can do the concert on the same day as the Balinese buffet so you can stretch the meal over music. Both were fantastic.

While there, you must do any trek with their guide Agus since he is a local with in-depth knowledge of the local traditions, cuisine, flora, etc..

Tip : Wander down just past the turning to the local Pura Luhur temple and there is a warung that serves delicious meals for USD1$. But be prepared for the hygiene levels of a local village rickety little shop :)

Warning : Although the Lonely Planet puts them on the same page as Pura Luhur batukaru and Jatiluwih rice-terraces, this resort is near neither although you can probably arrange to vist both (highly recommended) on your way there / away.
title: Be comfy hermit!

text: This was our second trip to Bali, we wanted to visit an area in the mountains different from those places where everybody is going to. With the help of the reviews from tripadvisor we came to Bali Mountain Retreat. And i agree with all those reviews that's written. We stayed four nights in the Lotus House and it's quite an experience. We admire the whole complex, it's created in a beautiful way. What makes it very special is the "home-feeling", Richard en Rebecca Kaal created. The food prepared by Rebecca with as much as possible biological products is wonderful. Don't forget the springwater from the mountain we used for our daily shower, it makes a diference.  We had the opportunity to go to a tempelceremony in a nearby village organised by Richard and Rebecca, we will not forget. We did'nt feel like we were tourists. The music night, songs from the '60/'70 performed by Richard brought memories back, which we enjoyed. And then you have Augus who can guide you for a ricepaddy-trip and other trips. There are many things you can do, it's up to the guest. We are planning to go back, because this place gave us that unique experience.
title: Loved it all!

text:
I only travelled to the retreat for the one night stopover. This was for one of those wonderful musical evenings conducted by Richard.
It is a great place with a wonderful feel. The view from the mountains is incredible.
title: What a great place

text: We stayed at the Bali Mountain Retreat for three nights and couldn't have been more pleased. The location was idyllic, the food was exceptional, the rooms lovely, and the service magnificent. We fell asleep each night to the sounds of the rainforest and woke up each morning to a rural location with beautiful views. We look forward to returning in the near future.
title: A mountain haven from the tourist crowds of Ubud and Kuta

text: Set in the maintains away from the tourist spots, amongst the local village and staffed by local villagers - how could you want anything else - the real Bali. We had a yoga retreat here, well catered for. The food was made from local foods, was vegetarian and some of the best food I’ve ever tasted. The cooks are amazing and so friendly. This is such a tranquil place. We were also able to do walks to local temples, rice paddy fields and seeing so many produce - cacao, coffee, cloves, snake fruit, bananas...the list goes on. We also went for a drive to a larger temple and hot springs, worth a visit and not hundreds of visitors as is at the more we’ll known temple by the sea. Oh and masseus Lusi was incredible!
title: What an amazing retreat

owner_response.text:
Thanks Megan, 

Lusi very happy to hear that ;-)
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: The Bali Mountain Retreat is a true hidden gem! The Tabanan region of Bali is my favorite with endless rice terraces, lush jungle, abundant plant life, and quiet village life. The retreat is gorgeous and the intimate size creates a lovely homey feel. Our room was incredibly for the inexpensive price and the food at the restaurant is wonderful! Pletny of vegan options :) The staff were also lovely! Will definitely come back next time I'm in Bali! Don't miss out on this gem!
title: Beautiful Bali!

owner_response.text:
Thanks Elizabeth, 

big hugs!!!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: What a beautiful retreat space has been created here. The salvaged Javanese buildings, the delightful gardens, the yoga/meditation space with a view to Mount Batukaru and the treetops, the opportunities to tap into Balinese culture and village life, massages from Lucy, and the wonderful, relaxed can-do spirit of the staff..made for a calming, nurturing experience. Thank you Bali Mountain Retreat.
title: A taste of old Bali

text:
WARNING: This accomodation is rated BBB. It has an extraordinary botanical content. Garden enthusiasts will find it very difficult to leave. All guests will find it relaxing to the point of immobility. Visitor discretion is advised!

If you are looking for an off-the-beaten-track place to stay in central Bali without aircon and the accompanying big-hotel feel, I can’t recommend Bali Mountain Retreat more highly. 

It is like a miniature Balinese village but without its own temple. The villas are simple but lovely. The gardens are wonderful. The food is excellent (there are even cooking classes). Best of all, the small number of staff make you feel as though you are staying with friends rather than as guests. My friend even got to help with the cooking and cooked dinner for the staff! 

35 years ago I backpacked my way through Indonesia. This beautiful place provides those of us who want a similar experience without all the mosquitos, ants, mandis, endless vegetable-free nasi goreng, dodgy chicken and other discomforts. We climbed Gunung Batukaru (2,275m), we’re invited to attend the annual full moon ceremony in a nearby village (the only outsiders present), saw the village children give a dance performance for their parents to gamelan music played by their fathers, had the best massage ever (which I sorely needed after G. Batukaru!), and totally chilled out. 

I often say I’ll go back to places I’ve enjoyed staying at, but rarely do. Somehow I feel I will return in this case as, surrounded by the luxury, faux authenticity, fixed smiles and impersonality of my current up-market hotel in Ubud, I miss the simplicity, homeliness and genuine friendliness of the Bali Mountain Retreat already.

Thank you Putu and friends. I will see you again. 

Paul
title: Paradise Found

text: A truly wonderful place - the photos don't do it justice. As soon as I walked through the entrance gateway felt transported into a wonderful little world of lush gardens that frame a variety of traditional houses - each different. The staff are gorgeous and the activities include pleasant hikes through rice fields, rivers, plantations, and to temple ceremonies with local guides that are passionate about their heritage. At the retreat there are massages and delicious meals. Something magical about this place.
title: Better than the photos!

text:
Staying at The Bali Mountain Retreat is one of the best decisions you could make if looking for some peace of mind.With spacious rooms that overlook a luscious green garden and a cool crisp climate that ensure a breath of fresh air,you couldnt feel more relaxed. To add on to it,the food was absolutely delicious!
Thanks to Rani and her staff for taking care of us.
title: Realxing and peaceful get away

text:
Enjoyed our time at this retreat very much. The jungle hike and the bicycle ride to the beach were well done. Our guide Putu did a great job. Also, the massage therapist was very good as was the restaurant and staff. Our room was comfortable and pleasant. 
The air, especially in the morning, was cool and the lack of insects was a pleasure.
title: Holiday

text: Bali Mountain Retreat is nestled in a luscious setting surrounded by beautiful terrain everywhere one looks! The mountain rises up through miles of gorgeous flowers and rich green rain forest.  Lovely accommodations lay among the flowers, shrines and temples gracing the space. Nights are soft with the sweet smell of flowers in the air. The kind and efficient staff made my stay delightful and lovely.
title: Spirit of the Mountain

owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. Hope one day you will visit us again. Namaste.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I recently stayed at Bali Mountain Retreat and had an amazing time. The room we stayed in was spacious and clean. Very cool in the evenings, which was a fantastic break from the heat. I loved being sung to sleep by the frogs after the summer storms. So peaceful and a great change from the hustle and chaos of the main 'tourist spots' of Bali. 
The staff were friendly and very polite. Loved all the fresh organic vegetables grown on the property. Delicious and tasty. I really enjoyed my hot stone massage. A must! 
I climbed to Mount Batukaru Temple which was a really good workout. Surrounded by jungle, its beauty was exquisite. Butterfly's and there many colours, lizards, and different species of birds. 
I highly recommend staying at Bali Mountain Retreat.
title: Piece of Heaven

owner_response.text: Terima Kasih Rachel. Thank you for taking the time to review your stay and for your nice words. Our staff says Hi ;-)
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: My girlfriend and I LOVED our stay in the 'Vishnu' room at Bali Mountain Retreat. This place is a WONDERFUL escape, high in the mountains, away from all the problems of modern Bali.  Clean air, water and land -- far away from traffic.  Beautiful views, jungle walks, great food, friendly service.   Rooms are simple, but aesthetic and pleasing, everything you need.  Perfect for anyone wanting to get away from tourist-ravaged Bali, back to a far more traditional part of the island. Great for couples - we love it.  Had been before, and we will be back!
title: Perfect Escape from 'Modern Bali'!

owner_response.text:
Hey Jay, looking forward to welcoming you again :-)
Thanks for your kind review. Greetings from the mountain.
Rani & Team
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
What an undiscovered gem this place is.

I wanted a few days of the beauty of Bali without all the chaos and craziness of the southern towns.

Bali Mountain Retreat was just perfect.

Bali is awash with beautiful locations.  And the people of Bali are generally wonderful.  And the foods are just yum.  To bring it all together on the side of a mountain and create that sense of being a part of some place special- if only for a few days - was wonderful.

Rani and the staff were accommodating and made it easy to relax and quietly bliss out.  Rooms were quiet and well appointed

The climb to Mount Batukaru Temple can be done on your own or with a guide.  I
 chose to go on my own - I'm a strong walker and the track is obvious (if steep!!!).  Definitely worth it to experience the eerie silence.

The food, mainly locally sourced, was great.  Fresh and full of flavour.

The only inconvenience was internet speed.  Slow. 

I spent two lovely mornings in the bird's nest looking out and over to Kuta and the ocean.There a couple of really cool places that you can find where you can just sit and enjoy.

I know that a lot of people are scared of the volcano.  It is on the other side of Bali.  And seriously, I think that the media has beat up the story ....

It was the perfect way to wind up my 6th visit to this country.
title: Literally in the clouds

text:
Someone else wrote "not a luxury place" and they were right! We stayed 4 nights at the recommendation of a friend who had been before a couple of times and she loved it. So while I knew to expect fairly simple accommodation, I think I was a little taken aback at just how basic. It took me a day or so to adjust my expectations down.
The staff were very friendly, polite and helpful as we've come to expect from many trips to Bali, so definitely no complaints there.
It was rainy season, and it really did rain heavily every afternoon. Lovely if you were inside, but if you had to walk from your room to the communal bathroom, you were in trouble. Thankfully we had an ensuite, but it was pretty basic and I was always glad to be done in the bathroom and get back to the main room, closing the door to keep the mosquitos from entering through the gaps above the bathroom walls. Don't let anyone tell you it's too high up in the mountains for mozzies!!
No air con (which I knew in advance) but a ceiling fan which was fine. No kettle, just a thermos of boiling water brought to the room each day, and tea/coffee/sugar/creamer. A jug of water was provided too, but I didn't trust it (even though staff reassured us it was filtered and UV treated). We decided to buy bottled water from a shop down the road just to be safe.
On our first night, the power went out as we were finishing dinner, and although the staff were very helpful, giving us torches and holding umbrellas so we could get back to our room, we discovered that not only did no power mean no lights, no ceiling fan, and no hot water, but in fact only a trickle of cold water too!! I guess it needed an electric pump or something. So no showers for us that night, we were not impressed! Sometime during the night the power must have been restored, but it made for a very unpleasant first night. We later learned there was a backup generator but for some reason they didn't use it.
We shared our room with a couple of big spiders (quickly dispatched by hubby), and a very large gecko who made himself known throughout the night, with an incredibly loud call every 10 - 15 minutes or so. We even recorded him one night it was so loud. The noisy frogs outside in the garden weren't quite so disturbing. We also had coarse dust falling from the ceiling onto our bed every time someone walked on the floor above. 
For the first 3 nights we were the only guests, which was mostly lovely for the peace and quiet, but it also meant that some of the meals were not as freshly prepared as we had expected based on descriptions of the place. We heard the microwave going in the kitchen too many times for my liking.
On the other hand, the location of this place is awesome. We walked every morning (no guide necessary), down the mountain, up the mountain, down the mountain again. Beautiful Balinese jungle walks, rice terraces, plantations, and friendly locals (the dogs bark at you but quickly retreat if you challenge them, lol). We spent the wet afternoons reading, chatting, having massages (around 130,000Rp to 180,000Rp), napping, and watching the daily downpours from the daybed in our room. We woke early one morning to see the sunrise from the "bird's nest" on top of one of the buildings, and got to see Mt Agung puffing a little bit of white smoke, the day before it erupted!
This is a truly beautiful part of Bali and a great location for getting away from it all, but just be prepared that BMR is definitely not a luxury hotel.
title: Mountains, jungles and noisy geckos

owner_response.text:
Thank you very much for taking the time to write such a detailed review.
A few short comments on your remarks. This month we will install brand new mosquito nets, even though we have little problems with mosquitoes, we realised it gives this extra feeling of protection and coziness. We assure you the water is clean and safe. We never had a problem with it in ten years and our yogis who come here for retreats love it.
Up in the mountain we do sometimes have a power cut, particularly when it's raining a lot. The backup generator should have been started within a few minutes, we apologise it did not do so in the first night. We have informed our staff to review the procedure.
Yes you are correct, we are not a luxury hotel, and we do not claim to be, also our prices - so we believe do not suggest that :-)  Still, we will continue to improve and with the help of wonderful guests like you who take the time to write such supportive reviews, we will. 
Hope to welcome you again to the wonderful area of Batukaru.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Very nice, clean room/bongalow and very peaceful surrounding.
Its a perfect place for a time off from everything, and for daytrips in the jungle with or without a guide.
It is not easy to get around on the island on your own from here, unless you have a budget for a driver all the time. But - if you are here just for the jungle and Walking trips in the area - its a wonderful jungle and rice fields a little longer to reach.
And not to mention the food. Its great, fresh and homemade!! 
And thanks for the fantastic massages at the place!!!!!
Kind regards
 

DENMARK
title: Bali mauntain retreat

text:
We spent three nights here at the start of our Bali Holiday. The Retreat is clean, authentic and an oasis. We did 3 fantastic walks with a fabulous guide. Our afternoons were spent with massages and resting. Lucy was our massage therapist and she was amazing.
The food was fresh, uncomplicated and clean.
We had lunch and a swim one day at the hotel next door and that too was fabulous.
Looking forward to getting back there.
title: The Perfect Escape from the Hustle and Bustle

text:
I hosted a week long yoga retreat at Bali Mountain Retreat and will definitely be returning to host more retreats at this venue. All was amazing. Beautifully friendly, helpful staff that create a wonderful atmosphere with their infectious laughter. The food was incredible and varied with a lot of produce grown right on the grounds with organic consciousness at heart. The rooms are lovely as is the surrounding environment.The Yoga studio is a lovely space with a good wooden floor and the Massage Therapist is very good. 
When I was searching for a retreat venue there were a lot of options available but the Bali Mountain Retreat centre I found very clear with their information and clearly have a lot of experience in hosting retreat groups. Every detail is thought of. 
I look forward to returning to perfect place for a  Mountain Retreat haven.
Jaymin
title: The Perfect Retreat

text: People were very friendly and so helpful. Rooms clean but a bit musty because of so much rain. Dance studio clean and ready for us everyday. Meals were good but mostly at room temperature instead of hot.  Hikes and temple visits were excellent. Massage therapists very good.
title: Dance retreat

text: Excellent staff who went the extra mile. Good choice of food, superbly cooked. Richard is an excellent host - informative and friendly. Lots of private space to relax, work or contemplate.  Arriving in torrential rain was an interesting experience!
title: Beautiful and relaxing environment

text: The staff at Bali Mountain Retreat welcomed us like family and took every care to ensure all the needs of our Retreat participants were catered for. The food was fresh and mostly locally sourced with a good range of choices at each mealtime. In addition, the cultural activities we were able to include in our package, such as Balinese music, dance and Temple visits,  created some very special highlights because of their local and authentic value. Our opportunity to dance and work in the beautiful surroundings of the upstairs Dance Studio enabled us to create Sacred space for all our sessions. A unique and really memorable venue for a very special Retreat, thank you so much. We will be back.
title: Wonderful hospitality on Mount Batukaru

photos.caption: Staff at evening of Balinese Dance in the Jogolo

text:
From the minute we left the "good" roads and started bumping our way up to the Bali Mountain Retreat I knew that I was in for a treat.
Rani and Richard had arranged pickup for me in Ubud and it was a pleasant journey up to Gunung Batukaru.
I spent 4 blissful nights in this special place and loved every minute. From the beautiful lush gardens, to the supremely stunning views from the restaurant and look out tower - everything about this place was utterly easy, pleasant and blissful.
For me I just had to fill my days between meals (and the meals were all mouth watering!) Each morning you would select what you wanted for lunch and dinner that day so they had time to collect ingredients and prepare - and every meal was delicious.
Richard spent time chatting to all his guests and I really enjoyed our conversations. I felt completely rested and rejuvenated after a quiet and undisturbed four days here. Gede, the guide who took me on a short mountain trek, was extremely knowledgeable and I enjoyed it greatly. Would recommend this luscious spot to all travellers!
title: Complete and utter peace

text:
Richard and Rani have found 'the place'...
You are welcomed with humble fanfare. 
The meals in the restaurant are amazing. Not enormous choice but definitely true Balinese cooking. 
The native fauna made for interesting bathroom visits. Loved the frogs. 
The treks are a must but pack good walking shoes. 
Very quiet. When you leave you will miss the bird songs, frog calls and geckos
title: Away from the maddening crowd

text: I travelled on my own to Bali Mountain Retreat for a yoga and meditation retreat. I stayed a few nights extra either side of the retreat to do my own thing as well. BMR's driver picked me up from the airport and I felt so safe and looked after. The accommodation is lovely, clean and simple, serviced daily. The grounds are immaculate, beautiful gardens and spots to relax and enjoy the amazing views from the mountain. Food is also delicious and service staff are so helpful and friendly. Definitely make sure you do a couple of the treks through the rain Forrest and local villages, stunning! Loved it!!
title: A beautiful find! Amazing!

text:
Stayed at Bali Mountain Retreat for two nights.  Waited almost an hour for the car transfer from my hotel in Sanur to the retreat (which I’d paid for). I ended up calling the Manager and asked where the driver was. He was sitting in the car park and just didn’t enter the hotel lobby – where I was waiting. I haven’t had any driver in Bali not enter the lobby before or tell the concierge he was here and I wasn’t going to wait outside in the heat! I wasn’t impressed. No apology when I arrived – I was told the Manager was away.  The weather wasn’t great so I just ate my lunch and retreated to my room with a book. The room was comfortable but the walls are very thin and I was kept awake until after midnight by some loud Europeans drinking it up in their room and then woken at 4am by crowing roosters. 

Having said that, the location is gorgeous and you won’t see all the plastic trash around that you sadly find in many other parts of Bali. There are 3 resorts in the immediate area all fairly close together and the owners should be applauded for the work they have done in educating the local villagers not to burn and throw their trash on the ground and not to poach the forest birds –  I hate seeing the poor creatures trapped in those tiny cages hanging in the heat that you see in a lot of  villages of Bali. So this was a big draw for me (the nature) and the region is unspoiled by tourism.  The following day, I took a trek through the rice paddies with a friendly, knowledgeable guide. This was the highlight of my short say. So clean and green – much better trek than what I’ve experienced in Ubud and surrounds. Unfortunately the weather turned after lunch and it rained the rest of my stay. There was nothing to do but … read again. I was bored, but this was only due to the weather and because I was alone. There were no other activities around for the afternoon but if it was sunny or not even raining, I would have taken one of the mountain bikes and explored. The weather prevented this. I would like to return to this area of Bali as it’s truly gorgeous and unspoiled and the owner has done a great job with the efforts they have made with the local community.
title: Absolutely beautiful region of Bali

text:
This is my 3rd time staying at Bali Mountain Retreat. Nothing compares to what this mountain transcends - a place to clear the mind, be inspired and get those creative juices flowing. 
The retreat is surrounded by immaculate gardens & scattered with traditional teak-houses that are cleaned daily. Food is always fresh, delicious & delivered with a smile. :) I have stayed in 3 different types of rooms - each has been unique and tranquil.
There are also many options for adventurers -  take a guided hike, bicycle ride, visit picturesque rice paddies, hot springs and temples.

Bali Mountain Retreat is the perfect place to invite true Balinese culture into your heart. You'll never want to leave :) x
title: Serenity now

text: It's a good place to relax or take a massage,you can rest,walking,trekking,reading,breakfast is complete,good food,try ayam Karen delicious! I miss a swimming  pool.good place,free wifi nice views from the bird's nest viewpoint they have several treks walks and mountain biking tours
title: Beautiful place

text:
We are currently in our third day at the retreat and have loved our stay so much that we couldn't wait to review it. To get to the retreat we were picked up from ubud by a driver, arranged through here, who took us to pura luhur batukaru, a gorgeous temple in the area, a short walk via rice paddies as well as to a coffee and cocoa plantation, all for a very reasonable price. 
When we arrived at the remote retreat we were slightly concerned that being carless, we'd be stuck at the hotel and forced to eat our meals only here. We were thrilled to discover that the restaurant here serves absolutely fantastic Indonesian food (the sweet pork and red curry are our favorites) and the price for the food is not too expensive.
The resort itself is located in the foothills of mount batukaru with breathtaking views of the jungle and the feeling of the place is simply idyllic.
We took two treks offered by the resort- the first was a four hour walk to the rice paddies. Along the walk our kind and knowledgeable guide (Gudey- clearly misspelling here) talked to us about all the plants and birds we saw and gave us a ton of fruit to try along the way as well including: passion fruit, snake skin fruit, cacao and candlenut. We saw vanilla, smelled fresh clove leaves and saw coffee trees. After tasting the jungle we arrived at a small stream between two rice fields where we sat for 30 min to 1 hour enjoying the peace and quiet, the view and the cool water. 
The second trek we took was the challenging but incredibly rewarding climb up mount batukaru. If you are up for a 3-4 hour climb up a steep jungle and another 3-4 hours down (or longer depending on fitness level) this is a must! The rainforest is simply an amazing experience and at the top we were rewarded with views of mount agung and merapi peaking through the clouds.
The resort also offers massages, which we hear are fantastic and cooking classes.
If you want to disconnect from the world while eating great food and having the opportunity to do a lot of amazing hiking or simply relaxing, this place is a must!
title: Welcome tranquility

text: Most places in bali are having additions or renovations and there is constant building noise. This place was the exception. There are several types of accomodation - up market ensuite on the lower level, teakhouse ensuite and shared bathroom. I took the shared bathroom teakhouse sunrise facing with magnificent view and wonderful included breakfast on a 5 night package. Excellent value. Very pleasant management and great guests. Retreats are regularly held here so there is a serene ambience worthy of an ashram.
title: peace and quiet

text: If you are seeking a nice, quiet, relaxing and authentic place in Bali, here you are at the right location. The retreat is both very clean with all modern amenities (incl. wireless connection), and also a taste of traditional Balenese way of life. You will have direct contact with Balinese staff, who will answer to all your expectations, learn how to cook, provide relaxing massages. We've done also mountain bike with a guide in surroundings villages and rice fields : a really nice way to meet balinese people, discover their dayly life, away from usual touristic areas. We stringly recommand this guest house.
title: A cosy retreat in Bali far from touristic areas

text: My wife and I spent three great days at BMR in mid-April and can't recommend it more highly. We had heard great things about the place and did some great hiking in spectacular intact forest (not much is left in Bali), walked to rarely visited temples, and experienced an incredibly beautiful off-the-beaten-path part of Bali. As a birder, I was hoping to do a bit of birding and was greatly impressed. BMR has two guides (Gede and Putu) know most of the local birds and are very good naturalists.  The ideal thing about BMR is that you have access to several native forest types including some spectacular cloud forest) as well as plenty of forest edge, riparian, and agricultural habitat. The gardens around BMR are also quite productive. I think that BMR is likely one of the best home bases for seeing some great birds and you get to stay in a really cool place with great food and a wonderful staff.
title: Birding and more at Balit Mountain Retreat

text:
Very peaceful; a great chill out place for a few days. Interesting walk with guide to rice fields. Saw and sampled an abundance of different fruits picked straight from the trees. Delicious.

Rooms comfortable, quiet and clean. Staff friendly and efficient. Food is tasty and well cooked, although the menu is a little limited. I guess it needs to be as it is freshly cooked daily.
title: Relaxing retreat

text:
Richard and the team offer a lovely , restful place to stay nestled in the mountains away from the hustle and bustle . 

The photos on the website don't do the place justice , the rooms are well set out and comfortable and the scenery is beautiful . 

The food and service are great and there are some nice guided walks nearby to rice paddies and temples . The hot springs are also worth a visit , a short car trip
Away . 

The massages and treatments offered are if a high standard . The menu offers great variety and the service is good . 

For creature comforts book a room with an ensuite . 

The retreat has a well equipped yoga/ meditation studio that is perfect for groups .

Get up early and see the sunrise from the birds nest , it's well worth it !
title: Beautiful , peaceful location in the mountains

text:
I had stayed in BMR for 2 days and how I wish I could stay there for more days~

The owner Richard and Rani are so nice and treat you like families.

The driver Wayan is so friendly and he will stop anywhere for you to take pictures on the way. Wayon stopped by the country road to pick the snake fruit and passion fruit which made my transportation to be an ADVANTURE!

Waiter Pruti always has a beautiful smile on her face for any request you ask for.

BMR is a tranquil place for you to retreat and stay away from outside world, there is no commercials nearby which make you calm down.

This is definitely a palce I will choose again.
title: Excellent place for stay more days

text: I had an amazing stay and retreat at Bali Mountain retreat. The close feeling to nature and this wonderful environment is just amazing. The staff is so nice and the food is fresh an tasty. I hope I will be back soon. Thanks
title: Back to nature

text:
I have been to the Bali Mountain Retreat twice in the last year,
The grounds are beautiful well kept and calming. The rooms clean and comfortable and daily room service. The food was very good the service delightful.I loved the guided walks they were very enjoyable, And the massages are heavenly ( especially the 2 hour hot rock massage !). I get a day tour from airport to retreat with a guide that speaks english and see some of the beautiful sights on the way up there. The staff make you feel very welcomed and cared for from the drivers, guides, kitchen staff  and management. I am looking forward to my next visit already. ( my little piece of heaven ) 

Vicky Webb
title: My little piece of Heaven.

text: Known BMR for the last 3 years keep coming back for the beauty of nature.., friendly staff.owner always sit awhile or give attention to the guest, food is very good, each room different view .. Local also very nice. In rainy day use the spa for massage, dry day good for walking in the forest,healthy fresh air. Beautiful garden,, feel home
title: Beautiful place to be for peace and quiet

text:
If you are looking to get away from the hustle of city life and want to see the natural Bali then this is the place to be. Nestled high in the mountains amongst dense forest it is a real heaven on earth. 

You can book a driver for the day to go into ubud or Kuta if you you feel the need for retail therapy, but for us the only therapy we needed were the amazing massages offered in the traditional spa.

The food was great with some of the fruit,veg and spices coming direct from the garden, it doesn't get any fresher than that. The flavors and presentation of the food was of a quality restaurant with service to match.   

The grounds of the retreat are beautifully kept and the people are so friendly and willing to help. It was all so good we are trying to fit in another visit later this year.
title: Amazing natural beauty

text:
We stayed a couple of nights here and enjoyed our stay. The garden is beautiful and tranquil, and being on a mountain area the weather is more comfortable than the bustling lowlands. The food here is affordable and excellent quality. The folks here are really friendly (the owner stays in the same property) and will try to help where they can.

Pity we came with 2 very young kids and after a while, we ran out of things to entertain them and so had to cut short our stay. But I could see myself here again in the future, this time just to hang out for a week or two just to read a book, do yoga and chill.
title: Good place to chill and get away

text: We were only intending on spending three days here, but we ended up lengthening our visit each day by a day more. The atmosphere is great- the gardens are very well maintained, the rooms are comfy, and the staff is fanstastic. We also did two of the treks they offered- our favorite was the rice field trek. Make sure to do this! It was one of the highlights of our trips to Bali. Food was also excellent, and I appreciated the large breakfast portions (go for the pancakes!).
title: Great place to spend a week

text: I stayed AT BMR for 3 nights in February and it has been one of my best stays ever and most certainly my best stay in Bali. Everything just works together smoothly, from the friendly staff, well-kept premises and amazing views to the outstandingly great food that is freshly prepared when you order. What I really appreciated was that the prices for the food are really friendly so you don't get the feeling of being locked in because you're too far away from any other restaurants. The best thing were my conversations with the owner Richard who often came down to the restaurant for a good chat, giving me tips for where to go and what to do. He and his staff always took time to listen to my questions and the whole retreat is simply very well organised. This truly is paradise.
title: Very homey and welcoming

text:
What a lovely gem in the middle of Bali! 
Just what we needed, my partner and I were only here for a few days, wish we could've stayed longer. It was truly perfect. From the moment we arrived I was speechless, from the beautiful room, (my jaw hung open!) to the amazing service from staff. I can't call them staff, they were more like a family, and not service, but a home away from home. Such warm people.  If you are looking for superb food (freshest and the best I had in bali), a really good nights sleep (such a comfy bed!!) friendly atmosphere/surroundings, fantastic massages, lush greenery, overlooking the rainforest and mount Agung in the background.... And lovely warm sunrises and sunsets.... This is the place to be! 
We took part in cooking classes, we enjoyed them so much, we booked in for more... And recreated them on our return home! We tried the jungle walk, and the temple walk, both were very wholesome, and the guide was lovely, explaining things along the way. Yoga studio was a perfect place to stretch out after the walk! And the fresh coconuts after a morning walking, refreshing! Loved the chocolate and coconut milk shakes.... Loved the Gule Ayam and Nasi Campur! 
It was spot on to what we were looking for. And Richard and Rani, what can I say.... It was so difficult to leave, you made our trip perfect, you have an amazing retreat. All the little things were thought of. 
If I were to plan a trip to Bali, I would definitely stop here again... And for longer!
Thank you very much to the Bali Mountain Retreat family for looking after us and making our trip perfect.
title: Just what we needed!!

text: Oh people this was the best place we stayed in Bali. Forget about the crowed in the beach Bali places. Go away from the noisy, polluted and not secure towns of Bali and go in the jungle to experience the real life of the Balinese people. The resort has a line of delivering peace, touch to the nature, modesty and calmness. Everything you get in touch with during the say is actually underpinning this line and me and my partner felt like home, like in the nature, like in a place where we want to live forever because we actually spent only 4 days. Excellent style. You may see the build,if saw itch different architecture and each one has different purpose of use, such as massage, yoga, spending leisure time during the day, and all this is accessible free. If you want to be alone you can. You may want to strand I no the jungle or hike to the rice fields or the temple. The food is exceptionally good, natural clean! The cook is also very good prepared to respond to your demands if you may have any. We enjoyed two evening of our stay talking with Richard and some others from the staff and shared lots of fun and meaningful opinions and insights about the life, society and the future of the planet. When leaving we knew that we will come back again. Meanwhile for the rest of my stay on Bali - all together 30 days I haven't slept so peacefully than in BMR. People just go just experience this place, the service and the sencerity of the staff.
title: Amazing place to be, to relax, to get on the tracks to connect with the nature etc. ...

text: I've selected BMR to be away from the busy areas of Bali and to take a couple of days to rest up in the mountains and see a bit more than the usual tourist track. It was the perfect choice! Located literally at the top of a hill surrounded by tropical forest, this is ideal for those searching for a time off and more interaction with Balinese people. The staff was fantastic, the tour to the temple something I won't forget that soon. Really beautiful and full of teachings! The yoga studio is also great, all that one could wish for a yoga class. Thanks, BMR. Zuleika
title: Astonishing location, peaceful and wonderful staff!

text:
I stayed at BMR for two wonderful weeks, and I wouldn't have wanted to be anywhere else in the world! This retreat is a real Gem; nestled away in the tranquil mountains close to the paddy fields, it seems an eternity away from the hot and stuffy tourist cities in Bali. Surrounded by beautiful lush greenery, the retreat has a wonderful quiet, calming energy and an abundance of wildlife perfect if your looking for an escape into the countryside.

The rooms were more than adequate; clean, cool and comfortable- we stayed in the teak house, a traditional Balinese wooden house which was decorated with traditional furniture and beds on stilts. This was a wonderful experience and I had the best nights sleep with only the sound of the crickets and resident geckos to drop off to...

The food at BMR was truly amazing, and the best food I ate in my time in the whole of Indonesia!! All meals are cooked to order from the freshest, locally sourced ingredients, some of which were picked daily from the organic vegetable garden. The menu was varied and a pleasure to choose from- breakfast, lunch or dinner! The flavours which were produced in every meal were absolutely divine and the food was obviously cooked with lots of love and experince!

We were welcomed by Richard and the team with open arms and they continued to be as friendly and helpful throughout my entire stay. The staff at BMR were always happy, smiling and willing to help. Richard spent time with all the guests, talking about travel plans, and offering worthwhile advice.. We were even lucky enough to spend a few evenings sharing stories in the dining room!

I would recommend Bali Mountain Retreat to absolutely anyone- singles, couples, families, groups.

There are plenty of hikes, walks, temples, sights etc within a drive of BMR and Richard and the staff will give you all the information you need to satisfy your needs!
title: A Hidden Gem!

text: My husband and I bought the couples weekender package which included all meals, transportation, accommodation, a hike and massages. The lotus room was fantastic with its own secluded veranda with a breathtaking view. We enjoyed drinking wine in the veranda and watching the lush nature sounding the resort. I would recommend the hot stone massage at the in-house spa. A blissful 2 hours under the expert hands of the best masseuse in Bali!  The food and service was awesome and top notch!
title: A romantic weekend getaway!

text: As soon as i placed my bare feet on the beautiful landscape tucked away on Mt Batukaru i was instantly at peace. Spending 10 nights alone in this magical retreat enlightened my spirit, filled my mind with peace and invited one of the most inspirational humans into my heart. Nourished by the   delicious fresh organic delights from the garden, the sounds of nature and words of wisdom i left this humble place filled with gratitude. Blessings to all and see you very soon. xx
title: 'Magical'

text:
