I stayed at Bali Mountain retreat for 2 weeks and had an amazing time. Richard and his staff were very friendly, helpful and were a joy to be around. They really made my stay so warm and made me feel at home. It was great to have a jam with Richard also who is a great musician.

My room was beautiful, spacious and cool. This is a great spot to escape the humidity and enjoy a much cooler climate.

The food was outstanding. Everything was so fresh, tasty and beautifully presented. 

This really is a hidden gem up in the mountains surrounded by lush gardens, great facilities, great people and fab food.

Thank you Bali Mountain Retreat for making my stay a memorable and pleasant one!
title: Simply delightful!

text: We had one of the best experiences in Bali while being there. Richard, the owner, is a very friendly host and he will make a good effort to make you feel at home. Food is amazing, more expensive than Bali standards though still OK, and staff incredibly friendly. You should try Balinese massage there and also enjoy the tours around the village. Room service is really good and if you like yoga or dancing they have a nice studio upstairs. You can also read a book or watch the sun rising behind the volcano from the high balcony. We loved it!!!
title: A must go place

text:
A little bit hard to find,you should have a good driver from this hotel because the road leads across the jungle.Hotel is very nice,has beautiful garden with lots of exotic plants.
Delicious breakfasts and dinners.Exellent cooking class,we took part in it and tougt how to cook Nasi Campur.We love it!
Feels like real jungle!
title: Highly reccomended!

text:
We spent two nights at the BMR during our trip around Java and Bali. We wanted to avoid the most touristic locations and be in the mountains for some days. We found the BMR due to the treks they organise; we were recommended to do a trekking to the summit of the Batukaru instead of the Angung and I can tell you, it's very, very good! A nice trek through thick jungle with a very pleasant guide. We ended up on the summit in the middle of a local ceremony, which was fantastic. On the way down, we entered the clouds which were a welcome cooling down after the sunny summit.

Besides the great activities offered, the food is very good and we also took a massage; I can only say, do take a massage when you are there, it is amazingly good. The rooms are really nice (we had a standard room, without a bathroom, but the shared bathrooms are of great quality and very closeby). Richard, who runs the resort, is a really friendly man and is really doing his best to let everybody enjoy their stay. Thanks!
title: Relaxing, very pretty environment and nice atmosphere

photos.caption: Ceremony on top of Mt Batukaru
Guide does a prayer at a temple

text:
I spent 5 days in this resort..Richard, who runs this resort, is a friend first, musician next and a businessman last :)

Richard ensures the guests are comfortable and have a good time in this resort. Thanks for the hospitality, mate!

If your idea of an evening dinner is to have a chilled beer and some great fresh salad or Balinese style dishes, with Richard re-counting his life experiences and there is silence all around, the weather chill...ah! Heaven!

Highly recommended if you want to be away from the touristy spots, be prepared to encounter some rough roads and some unfamiliar territory but is safe, thanks to Richards trusted aides..

Go Bali, Go to the Bali Mountain retreat. If you are lucky, you may end up getting free CDs and sarongs if Richard is in a generous mood! And he is usually in a good mood!
title: If there is heaven on earth...

text: We stayed at the Bali Mountain Retreat (BMR) for five nights in early August 2013 and absolutely loved it!  We arranged a transfer from Ubud through the BMR.  The drive took about two and a half hours but was very enjoyable.  The car was comfortable with air-conditioning and the driver was very friendly.  We were welcomed on arrival by Richard and Rani – owners and hosts.  They went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable, comfortable and relaxing, as did all of their wonderful staff.  The location is beautiful in the mountains of Bali away from villages, tourists and major towns – a wonderful place to get away and really enjoy peace and serenity, a bit of the ‘old Bali’.  As we booked only a week before we travelled to Bali we stayed in two different rooms during our stay.  First was one night in a superior teak house room – traditional style, hand built and beautifully crafted accommodation.  The room was beautifully decorated, clean, comfortable and well appointed.  It had a comfortable king size bed and separate bathroom with shower, toilet and sink.  Be aware the teak house is a circular configuration where you will share walls with other rooms so you will hear other guests going about their business.  Most guests are aware of this though and make the effort to be considerate with noise levels.  We then moved to the Lotus House which is a private bungalow.  Also built in traditional style it was clean, comfortable and well appointed.  The Lotus House had a separate bedroom, lounge area with day bed, TV and bar fridge.  The toilet and shower (separate areas) were under the main roof but outside the lounge/bedroom area.  It was absolutely beautiful and novel to enjoy showering in a private bathroom where, if you choose, you can leave the door open and look out over the amazing views across the mountain and trees.  The food at the BMR is incredible – we enjoyed every meal, particularly the traditional dishes.  They also offer a choice of western style dishes if you prefer.  We also highly recommend having a massage (or three) during your stay at the BMR.  There is a good selection of massages and other beauty treatments to choose from.  All are very reasonably priced and the spa staff are well trained and friendly.  The BMR offers a good range of hikes and activities though we chose to stay on the property and relax instead.  We can’t speak highly enough of the BMR - our stay was just divine and we loved every minute of it.  The accommodation, location, food, staff and hosts - it was all fabulous.  It was the highlight of our Bali holiday and we look forward to staying again in 2014.  Thank you Richard, Rani and the team. [Reviewed by an Australian couple aged 35-45].
title: Absolutely wonderful, highly recommend

text:
We spent 5 nights and 6 days at this place. Didn't feel like leaving... I will definitely visit again and recommend it if you want to experience real Bali away from the touristy places like kuta and Ubud...Unlike hot and humid places in Denpasar, weather here is pleasant during the day and cool at night. Everything positive I read on the trip advisor site for this retreat could be experienced..worth mentioning is their masseurs at the SPA are excellent. Most of us were vegetarians and the restaurant staff made sure we had enough options. They customized dishes for us and kids.
The entire BMR team makes sure our stay is comfortable. 
Richard is such a great host..we use to have discussions every night after dinner..I didn't read about this before in other reviews, You can access excellent collection of Balinese music recorded by Richard at BMR.
title: Beautiful, amazing and wonderful..The Real Bali indeed

text:
My wife and I spent 5 nights at the BMR in October. After spending 2 days in busy Ubud which is well on its way to becoming another Kuta, we were stunned to find this little gem of a resort, tucked away in the 'jungle'. Richard and his staff were helpful and friendly and made us feel at home immediately. The food in the restaurant was amazing, our room was spotless, the bathroom impeccably clean with hot water and a new shower. We had a little terrace with a view on the surrounding hills where we spent many hours reading and watching the panorama. 
The massage there was excellent and we also enjoyed the walks in the surrounding area, taking us through rice terraces, cocoa and coffee plantations and the many temples in the area. The only thing I will not recommend is the day trip in the car to the lake temple, which was crowded and more reminiscent of disney land than a place of worship.
We left feeling relaxed and rejuvenated and wishing we could have stayed longer!
title: Beautiful retreat off the beaten track

text:
This was my third trip to Bali, the first was 35 years ago, don't remember much from that experience, second was 2 years ago and I figured there has to be more to Bali than Aussies behaving badly. This time we came for 5 nights as a mature couple seeking the natural Bali and got fairly close. Richard and Rani arranged for us to be picked up from Kuta and driven to the resort, we would not have found it by ourselves. We chose an ensuite room with double bed which was very comfortable, the walls were a bit thin though. Guides on tours, although expensive, added value to each hike that you would not normally experience. 5 days was enough for an energetic couple as we had done all the activities on offer.
If you are coming for the yoga be warned that it is self managed as there is no resident yoga instructor.
title: The Real Bali

owner_response.text:
Thank you Bruce for your visit to the mountain and for your review.
Just to be clear to those reading this, we are a small retreat center and at times host different types of retreats, we do not advertise having a in house Yoga instructor on our website. We do have a Yoga / dance studio with mats etc which our guests are welcome to use anytime for practice.
All trek prices are on our website, the guides are paid very well which helps the local community. There is a payment made to the banjar as well for trekking. 
I hope you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again one day.
Thank you
Richard
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Had an excellent 4-day break in Bali Mountain Retreat.  Richard and Rani are great hosts!  Friendly, customer focused and with a beautiful place to recharge in nature!

Cool days (around 24/5'C) and cooler nights 22'C with lush vegetation and peace and quiet.  Only hear mainly birds and crickets.  Nice rooms and excellent meals.  Great for easy 1-3 hr walks where my partner and I recharged ourselves from city living.

Richard and Rani were very responsive to requests and join in for short chats during our meals to make sure that we are enjoying ourselves.  Richard kinda look like a gentle Balinese Willie Nelson (he sings and has CDs of his songs!) as he walks around in his sarong!

Great place to bring partner or family to relax.  Don't expect hectic excitement and you will have a great time!
title: Great sanctuary for my short break!

text:
I returned to the Bali Mountain Retreat for a second time and I know there will a third! It feelsso far away from the madness one can experience along the Bali coast yet only takes a couple of hours to get there from the airport.
BMR's tranquility and gentle atmosphere with the very welcoming host Richard and his staff, are unsurpassed in my Bali holiday experiences. 
The room i had was clean and very comfortable, the interior design beautiful.
I chose to do nothing at all but enjoy the massages offered, do some yoga in the available stunning yoga hall, eat the traditional food in the restaurant and stare at the stunning views. Maybe next time i'll visit the ancient temple and walk the trails up the holy mountain!
title: Tranuillity re-visited

text:
The 3 days we spent there were a marking point of our trip in Bali.
Tank so much Richard and the whole team for your hospitality and kindness. Particular thanks to Ferdi for the nice walks in the tropical forest and the temples ( with a ceremony just for the 2 of us: we still have the 3 gods'bracelets!)
A very authentic place far away from the hustle and bustle of the coast,  in a luxurious garden, a very comfortable and nicely decorated room, a delicious home-made cuisine, excellent massages; retreat is the right word!
We strongly recommend this place for a real and relaxing break
title: an unforgettable experience

text: High in the Balinese mountains amongst the rainforest with the luxury of beautiful serene accommodation and some of the best food I have eaten in Bali. Unpretentious but elegant, I loved   that there were so many little get away areas to laze around in. There were many daily activities on offer, including a temple walk where I was blessed by the local priest- and not in a tourist way either. I did a jungle walk the day before and there were rice paddy walks and bike rides on offer.The friendly staff were from the local village and the areas to walk in were permaculture heavens- small areas of coffee, salak, papaya and taro.Loved my room although the eco reading light could have been a little brighter. Massive bed elegantly made and masses of space to hang clothes.This would be the place to have a yoga retreat or writers workshop because of the separate Javanese joglo with  a gorgeous wooden floor and mirrors. I had a sleep at the entrance first -then did quiet yoga listening to the birds and looking at the birds eye view into the distance.-Gorgeous ! Get in early with your daily activity cos they can fill up....
title: The Ultimate Rainforest Get-Away

text:
My first visit to BMR was such a lovely experience I stayed again for 4 nights in June. I enjoyed the lovely room in the lotus house and I do love sharing the shower with a tree frog.. truly an experience in nature. Walking to the village and local temple through beautifully tendered crop gardens, stopping at a shine by a waterfall along the way and stopping to speak with friendly locals, not feeling in any way nervous to be walking alone - bliss. Richard was happy to organise tours for me tailored to my interests including Tanah Lot and Batukaru Temple.  A highlight was meeting like minded people over dinner in the beautiful restaurant with friendly staff and food that continues to be delicious. 
Tip - if you have just flown in bring some IDR up the mountain with you – there are no facilities locally to change money. Wifi reception is good but not so for mobile phones. A great place to relax BMR is off the beaten track!! Thanks to hosts Richard and Rani again for a wonderful stay.
title: Return visit and didn't want to leave!

text:
Driver from BMR picked us from Munduk Moding Plantation. Rani recommended that we do some sightseeing on the way and I was glad I took her recommendation. We visited Ulun Danu Beratan, Jatiluwih and Pura Luhur Batukau Temple. Drive to BMR was really bumpy at the last leg. Do give yourself ample time if you are heading to the airport.

Upon arrival, there was no check in and we were ushered to our room (the “Lotus House”) which we received a welcome from a frog which was on one of the side doors. No keys to the room but you can lock the doors from inside. Room is ensuite with bathroom however the WC is at the back and the shower area is at the front (porch area). A mosquito net and a stronger fan would have made my stay more comfortable as I am not a fan of insects. There are several families with young children during my stay and I am fascinated with the children’s curiosity of the insects and surround. I guess our exposure and upbringing is very different.

No worries about food. Most of the dishes I ordered were delicious. Do fill in the order chit the day before so that you can get your meals on time. On the 1st evening, dinner took quite a while to arrive as staff needs to cater to the pre-ordered dishes first. Some of my favourite dishes are: Mee Soto, Chicken Curry, Chocolate cake, Nasi Campur, Potato Croquette, Fiddletip Fern, Deep fried eggplant, Ayan Goreng, Gule Ayam & Fried Banana with ice cream. Breakfast is kind of slow in the morning but Richard is quite flexible with the timing for our trips. I love the pancake served with brown sugar. Many thanks to Richard for arranging a birthday cake for my friend and letting us dine at the Bird’s Nest.

We took 2 tours from BMR, “Cycling to hotspring” and “Rice field walk & Sarinbuana Village”. I find the cycling quite tough as the road has lots of potholes initially and it wasn’t easy to cycle up the slopes. Most of the way is downwards after that but I was terrible in keeping the bike straight down narrow slippery paths. Fell a few times and had several bruises on my legs. I have not cycled for years and have zero experience with bicycle gears. I believe most should be alright with the cycling. Hotspring cost IRD5,000 per person for the public pool and IRD100,000 per person for the private one. Walk to rice field and Sarinbuana village was easy except for some muddy parts at the rice field. It was great dipping in the river. One afternoon I rewarded myself with a 2 hours Hot Stone massage (IRD350,000). Massage was incredible as it soothes my bruises however it was kind of disturbing for about half an hour as there was a family playing just outside the spa room.

Journey from airport to BMR is about 2 and a half hours. But do not be intimidated by the distance if you are looking for pure relaxation among nature with great food. Richard is super friendly and never failed to chat with the guests daily.
title: Secluded but perfect for nature lovers

text:
A special place to stay away from the tourist path for a number of reasons:
 
- The rooms have the perfect balance of Balinese tradition with the comforts of a contemporary hotels. Clean, fresh & bright with beautiful aspects of the gardens. Each room has a sense of privacy and retreat. 

- The staff and owners are warm, friendly and professional. The food exceptional.

- Plenty of spaces on site to retreat to and relax through the day, and other activities can be organised for adventurous types. Trip the the local temple recommended.

Very much an oasis off the beaten track, travelling 2hrs by car through different villages to get to BMR is a visual treat.

When you arrive at BMR embrace the spirit of Balinese culture, relax, slow down to the real pace of life and you will surely be rewarded.

This holiday will be one that stays with you for all the right reasons.
title: Very much an oasis off the beaten track

text:
I stayed for a week at Bali Mountain Retreat practicing yoga.  The yoga space was perfect - I loved the early morning sunrise and mountain views.  The rooms were tastefully decorated, comfortable and clean.  The food was delicious and fresh, the massages wonderful, and the rural setting very relaxing.  The staff were friendly, efficient and professional - the service was outstanding.  Over our stay we got to know the staff, and them us.  Richard and family were charming hosts.  I enjoyed the friendly cats, the chatter of the geckos, roosters and ducks.  The temple visit was special.  The shop and cooking lesson were fun.

Thank you Richard and team.  I hope to return.
title: An outstanding holiday at BMR

text:
Spent a week at the BMR with a group from wellington for a yoga retreat.
this is a great venue to bring a group of people.  there were plenty of accommodation options to suit everyone. the yoga studio is fantastic. light and airy with a great view!
Food is amazing!  the daily specials prepared by the staff were great.  the guided activities were great, and fit in nicely between yoga sessions, especially the bike ride through the villages. Staff were delightful.
Really recommend this place to take a group of people to.  So peaceful relaxing and great gardens and scenery.
title: Great place for yoga retreat

text:
Bali Mountain Retreat is simple and beautiful, Richard and Rani are extremely good hosts,  They really make you feel part of the home, also nice and helpful staff will no doubt make your stay pleasant and easy. The food is excellent.

The bungalows are stunning, cozy, comfortable, wonderful and somewhere between art gallery and an antique.

Thank you,Richard and Rani for making our stay so enjoyable and comfortable

Hope to see u again next year.
title: Friendly hosts, comfortable room, excellent food

text:
This place has all the makings of a wonderful retreat. Unfortunately, our time there was disrupted by a lot of children.

Upon arrival we had to almost immediately change rooms due to an absolute riot occurring in the room next us. The staff were both gracious and obliging. Another guest promptly left the retreat early with some drama after having his massage disturbed by screaming kids. Our first morning's peace was then broken as a different family decided to congregate before 7.30am in the yoga room above many of the guest rooms, with children arguing and stomping about. The breakfast room was like a Club Med kids club and the tranquility was simply absent. We left to a separate pagoda area and found another couple and single traveller hiding from the chaos. They bemoaned to us having been woken by the yoga room marauders, the overrun breakfast area and children screaming about the retreat's grounds.

Richard, the owner is incredibly warm and genuine, and we enjoyed his company at mealtimes, but we think he would be well served making this place adults only.

The food was simply excellent. The dinner menu is stellar. The only disappointment was the use of quick instant oats in the breakfast muesli - it may have been instant porridge mix- which was an extra cost so really unacceptable. There were also several communication problems with waitstaff, including our reservation for dinner in the secluded lookout being cancelled because of a double booking. It would have been nice to find this out prior to arriving for our dinner looking forward to a romantic private evening in the lookout- we were told on arrival by the waitress we werent allowed to eat there as someone was having their birthday up there. Instead we ate with several others, who, like us, had been waiting to dine until after the cohort of children had disappeared.

The massage service was outstanding and the sounds of the jungle enhance the experience beautifully. It's reasonably priced.

We could see that Richard has created something wonderful here, and what was really sad for us was we didn't truly get to experience what this place was all about. Most likely we were on the wrong end of an unfortunate combination of events, but when you travel that far, and pay that much, it really needs more polish and a better policy on kids. The experience was not a 'retreat' for us.
title: A flawed gem.

owner_response.text:
Lachlan,  
Thank you for your review. Shame you were "on the wrong end of an unfortunate combination of events"
I feel it necessary to address a couple of issues.
This is the first time in many years that we have had a complaint about other guests children at BMR, maybe that is because we do not often have children staying with us as they usually prefer the tourist beach areas of Bali.  Unfortunately we can not screen families before they arrive, I will ,however, look more closely at the emails in the future to try and avoid this situation happening again. Concerning your suggestion I make this an adults only guesthouse,  I feel it very important to allow families with children to be able to enjoy this special part of Bali and enjoy nature, children should experience nature and develop a love and understanding for it.

We have now made sure the Yoga studio is locked early in the day, normally early morning Yoga is done in the Joglo, away from the rooms.
Concerning the noise of children in the restaurant during meal times.
We do have other areas ( the Cafe ) to have meals, the Birds nest is also available if someone hasn't prebooked this area for a special dinner. It is advisable to prebook the Birds Nest if you particularly want to have a private intimate dinner there. I will endeavour to make sure ALL staff are aware of prebooked arrangements such as this in the future.

Restaurant:  "  it may have been instant porridge mix- which was an extra cost so really unacceptable.  "
We pride ourselves on the food quality and freshness, the Oats we use in the homemade Muesli is Havemont Oats from Australia,( the best available here) combined with freshly grated , dried coconut from the gardens and dried fruit.  There is no extra cost for Muesli.

Lachlan, Such a shame you came in peak season, school holidays and encountered a very rare event here at Bali Mountain Retreat.
I hope you choose to come back sometime and experience the peace and tranquility so many of our guests comment on, a true haven from the hot, noisy tourist areas of Bali and where Balinese tradition still reigns. 
Thank you
Richard
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
This is an amazing place to stay! Like everyone else says, the staff is super friendly. The place is very relaxing and it is great to get away from the hectic touristy spots. We did a cooking class, which I would highly recommend. 

Sitting up in the 'Bird's Nest' with a cup of tea and a book, enjoying the view and the sound of birds is the way every holiday should be!
title: Would recommend this place

text: Richard's great retreat center was one of the few places we could find which would make a reservation for us during Nyepi, the Balinese New Year. It coulnd't have been better. The Nyepi parade began at the foot of the driveway. With Richard's sarongs we were suitably dressed to follow the parade to the village for the burning of the ochre-ochres. Tea under the rice drier of one of Richard's friends capped the evening. The remainder of the week was one memory after another unfolding effortlessly as Richard and his staff took care of our every need. Overall, a lovely place to get away in the mountains of Bali.
title: Great Nyepi hideaway

text: Wow!  What an amazing place to say.  I echo all the great feedback that other reviewers have written.  This place is amazing.  Just what I needed to chill out and relax.  The staff are super nice.  I came here with a reiki retreat group, and I cannot imagine a more suitable place for meditation.  Richard had also organised cultural activities for us - cooking lessons, hike to the local temple, medical/nature walk, dance performances.  I stayed in one of the ensuite rooms with a king size bed and a day bed overlooking the beautiful gardens.  It was clean, cool, and roomy.  The food was AMAZING.  Massage is a must.  And that clothes shop that Richard's wife runs... I couldn't stop buying the lovely locally made clothes.  To top it off, they have 4 friendly cats that chill out around the property.  Look for the big cat in the temple hut.
title: Relaxed, rejuvenated, recharged

text:
Bali Mountain Retreat is a special place in every way - the setting, the views and the people.
The owner Richard and his staff were wonderful and helpful.
Breakfast, lunch and dinner were amazing and always prepared fresh.
This was the best retreat I ever had and would go back any time!
title: "Pure Tranquility"

text:
Beautiful and breathtaking location. It was the perfect place for meditation and connecting with everyone. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The sheets were changed daily and the rooms cleaned daily. 
I look forward to staying again.
title: Absolutely wonderful place to stay, friendly and helpful staff.

text: Richard and staff looked after us very well, organising pickups from the airport and hotels all over Southern Bali, serving great food, and organising walks and cultural activities. Everything was taken care of and we relaxed into the peaceful and beautiful surroundings for our Reiki retreat. The meditation / yoga teaching space was spectacular with views to the mountain countryside around us. The staff were polite and friendly, and did an excellent job of understanding and executing our sometimes confusing meal orders. This is a great place for a group retreat, but also for a holiday away from the bustle of Kuta and popular resort areas.
title: Wonderful place for a retreat

photos.caption: Sunrise, Gunung Batur, and Gunung Agung from the Bird's Nest
View out of the Bale Gede

text: Truly a special place and the food is so amazing. There are so many great cultural/local experiences there and nearby, and the people who work there are so caring and thoughtful. Best value and the meditation/yoga space is very special. Can't wait to come back!
title: Goes beyond expectations x10

text: Bali Mountain Retreat is absolutely delightful. You will arrive and be pleasantly surprised by how clean, beautiful, and elegant it is. In addition to the ambiance, the food is delicious and there are great vegetarian options on the menu. The masseuse on staff is excellent - definitely some of the best massages I have ever had. I can't recommend this place enough - I spent less than a day in Ubud and three days at Bali Mountain Retreat, and I definitely made the right choice!
title: Blissful Stay

text: Sitting on a ridge overooking jungle beauty. Excellent food, enjoyable talks with our musician host, walks in nearby traditional village with friendly folks, reasonable rates. I loved my massage, our hikes, and the natural/isolated beauty. One issue- isolation means long taxi rides and some rough patches on the road. It's worth it. We had a beautiful, noisy rooster outside. oh, well.
title: We loved it- the place, views, people, food, walks

text: Stayed in this place by myself for 3 nights in March/April 2013 - absolutely great! Bali Mountain Retreat offers a place to really relax, in lovely calm and peace and quiet. The room I had was really gorgeous - big bathroom, lovely hot powerful shower, huge comfy bed and lovely decoration. Lovely touches like pretty folded towels and hot water/tea brought to your room every afternoon. Easily the nicest room I stayed in in Bali at this price range (£25-ish/night). Food in restaurant really delicious, huge portions and full of vegetables. Staff all really friendly and able to arrange a range of activities (treks, massage etc) as you want - though no pressure at all. Can't fault it!
title: Super Chill Out

text:
This place has it all and is a greatly recommended option for trvellers who wish to wonder off the beaten Bali path. 

- the original owner Richard, who can tell you all about the area
- the beautiful garden, which is always very quiet
- the ever friendly staff, who will do and bring everything you ask
- the possibility of activities, from walks to cycling and motorbiking. 
- Trip to Jatiluwih and Pura Luhur is now possible with a new backdoor road!
- the amazing true Balinese spiced food, which is very affordable

It is a bit hard to find, but easy with the provided map, and the road is really awful, but that is all great to block mass tourism from coming here. To watch over the jungle from the birdnest and see sunrise or sunset is simply amazing, and enough reason to make the trek.
title: Great original place!

text:
Real hard to find, poor road, but good directions from the website. Real friendly staff, comfortable rooms, great location 700 m high.
All services (bar, restaurant, massage, trecks, bikes,....)
Real dive in a "true" Bali.
Did the three hour jungle treck with the kids, a real feast !
Far from the crowds, a must do !
title: A true retreat

text:
Our flight arrived in Denpasar and we exited the arrival hall around 10:15pm.  The arranged driver was there with his sign as promised, and quickly escorted us to the vehicle.  The 2 hour estimate on the drive was very accurate, mostly because the roads to get to BMR are pitiful shape once you turn off the highway east of Tabanan, and start heading up the mountain.  Be prepared for a bumpy and slow ride.  

Once you do get there, you will find a very nice place.  We had a Family Superior Teak Room (2 bedrooms, sharing 1 bathroom).  It was comfortable, with the only minor annoyance being that there are little black ants all around.  This seemed to be the case throughout the retreat.  They also have 4 friendly cats (as friendly as cats can be).  

The restaurant has a nice selection of meals at very reasonable prices.  This is good since there is really no other choice but to eat at the retreat unless you are off on a day trip.  The Chicken Curry was very good, and the banana fritters for dessert.  

Putu is the head of the staff, and also serves as a local guide for the treks they offer.  He took us on the trek to see the local rice terraces.  This trek started off with about a 1.5 mile walk to a nearby village, then turned off the main road along a jungle path until coming out for an amazing view of the rice terraces.  Along the way, we samples Guava and Durian fresh from the tree.  We then trekked along the top of the rice terraces for a bit, until heading down for a quick swim in a mountain stream.  Very cold, but since we were a bit hot from the walk, it was nice.  

We took the day trip to the north coast to Lovina on our 2nd day.  It was a good idea to get away for the day, but would probably choose differently.  It was quite a long day in the Suzuki APV, for a short dip in the hot springs at Banjar, and then lunch in Lovina and a short stroll along the beach.
title: Great value with friendly staff

text: For those who wish to truly relax. We were here in Feb and loved it. This was the most relaxing part of our holiday and food was great as well. Very quiet and stunning scenery. Way off the beaten track for Bali. Make sure you get their driver as this place is not easy to find. The guided walk and the bike ride are a must do. Well worth the effort, Thanks Richard and staff for a great time.
title: Remote and Beautiful

text:
We enjoyed our stay at Bali Mountain Retreat although my partner was sick most of the 3 nights we spent here it was probably one of the best places to be stuck at. The grounds where pretty and has nice little tucked up huts on top of roofs great for reading and thinking. The food was fresh and made it with love, beautiful flavors made with the vegetables from the grounds. 

As for the rooms we stayed in the standard tek house it was basic but comfortable but not very sound proof has it had a big yoga studio on the roof which was made of wood. If someone was upstairs you would know about it. But saying that if yoga is your thing the upstairs is great big mirrors.The Aussie owner had Bob Dylan fetish and was laconic and talkative. He was always around if you needed him. Oh yes and lots of chatty cats to talk to also :) 

This place is only 2 hours away from the main strip kuta,seminyak so if you want to escape into the hills this place is ideal.
title: Great place to relax in the hills

text:
The Bali Mountain Retreat really lived up to its name as a retreat. Among just a few guests when we arrived, we immediately felt the calm, relaxing feeling that this hotel vibrates. We stayed in a superior room, which was tastefully decorated, had a king sized bed, and a semi-outdoor bathroom. The food at the restaurant was excellent and the service impeccable. You could tell that the employees were happy to work there. The hotel is made up of many different buildings on its lush grounds. There is no real view, so to speak, of the mountain itself from the bedrooms – however the view from the dining area is fantastic. 
Bali Mountain Retreat proposes different mountain trekking excursions, bike rides, massages, etc. We had unfortunately arrived at a period where the local priest had passed away and due to tradition, locals were not allowed to climb any mountains. We thus had to go exploring ourselves, which turned out fine. 
The hotel is very far off the beaten path and quite difficult to find. There is not much to do in the area other than the planned excursions mentioned above. This will not be a problem for those wanting to come to relax – which is absolutely impossible not to do at Bali Mountain retreat.
title: Very relaxing and enjoyable stay

text: Richard and Rani are such welcoming hosts and my first visit to the yoga temple sealed the deal on relaxation and tranquility.  Early morning sunrises  and late afternoon viewing from the Birds Nest was a special treat - all in all a most relaxing place to forget the madness of modern living. The food lacks nothing and the friendly staff are so smiling and helpful that  one feels like an honored guest.  Thanks to you all there - I am guessing you won't be able to tear yourself away and join us at The Pocket Richard.
title: BLISSED OUT ON TRANQUILITY AND A WONDERFUL YOGA TEMPLE

text:
Follow the advise of BMR and let you pick you up to come to the Retreat. A driver who hasn’t been here before will get lost so nerves will avoid you to enjoy the splendid views on the road to BMR. The rooms, location, views are like promised on the website, the food in the restaurant is excellent and so is the breakfast.
 We did some walks on our own, our host Richard Kaal, owner of BMR explained the road.
After Ubud and Lovina, it is nice to rediscover the other Bali we learned to know 25 years ago
title: Even the rainy season cannot spoil your stay in BMR

text:
BMR is a well hidden pearl in the central mountains near Mt. Batukaru it is one of the most beautiful places I ever been. 
In the resort all services are spot on and although it is a bit on the costly site for a budget traveller like myself it is worth every penny... 
Just go there and be amazed take some time off relax - treat yourself with the Bali Mountain Retreat  you want regret it!!!
title: A real retreat in Bali

text:
This is a lovely, wonderful, peaceful place to stay. Nestled in the mountains above the chaos of South Bali, this is a peaceful retreat with incredibly hospitable staff and a wonderful menu.
Cool and away from the heat, quiet and removed from the noise, there's no traffic, but good wifi, no crowds but wonderful staff and a great host.
The restaurant has excellent vegetarian selections and the staff are very helpful. They'll arrange rides, day-trips, laundry, and transport anywhere on the island.
Beautiful rooms with a lot of character, adorable cats, and even a great mini-spa.
After a few days in Seminyak, I am so very happy we came up here to stay for a few days.
title: A lovely place, warm hospitality

text:
We spent two nights here, and absolutely loved it. It is completely peaceful and quiet, and a true retreat. We would love to return for longer next time.

We stayed in the rice barn, which was fine for the first night, but the second night felt a little bit cramped. It's still a unique experience though, and I would definitely recommend it for short stays. The shared bathroom which comes with the rice barn is in excellent condition, and very very well maintained.

There are several beautiful common areas to relax in. Our favourite was the tall building with the lookout point, called the bird's nest (?). We spent many hours there with a good book. They also own a few lovely cats, some of whom curled up to us while we read.

The food is absolutely beautiful, with a lot of it from their own garden. Doesn't get fresher than that!

We also went on a hike to the local temple. This was the highlight of our trip. Putri and Ferdi were excellent guides. Although we are not big on temples, we enjoyed the visit, particularly the serene atmosphere.

We had massages, and according to my husband, it was the best one he received in bali. 

Their wifi works remarkably well for such a remote region. Much better than in some places in seminyak and ubud. 

Tip: get picked up and dropped off by their driver. The rates sounded a bit high to us, but they are really in such a remote area that I can't imagine it would be easy for someone not familiar with the region to find it. It was worth the price to not have to spend hours in a car trying to find it.
title: Heaven

text: Great way to pass the Christmas days and spend our last days in Bali.  The Bali Mountain Retreat is a true retreat located high in the mountains of Bali.  With delicious food and great staff a marvelous place to stay and get away of the busy tourist sites.
title: True retreat

text: We spent a very happy 5 days here, staying in the Lotus House. The location is amazing, surrounded by dense forest hiding innumerable small villages, and being at altitude kept it cool enough to walk through the tracks and rice paddies. The half day trips guided by local farmers were fascinating, particularly one to the local Temple for a Hindu ceremony,  and we also hired a car and driver for a day for a look around the island.  The facilities were  clean and spacious, the bed comfortable, and the view of the sunrise over Ganung Agung from the raised gazebo was  stunning. Finally everyone was very friendly (and so  were the four cats! ) and the staff efficient and helpful, even to extent of providing hot Sambals ( chile )  to satisfy our preference for hot spicy food. Getting away from the tourists traps comes at a cost, though, and the trip from the airport took nearly four hours, and the last half an hour was fairly challenging - but the driver arranged by the Retreat took it all in his stride, and we arrived without any drama.  All in all, a great way to unwind.
title: Bali as it used to be

text: Lovely staff. Very comfortable rooms a mixture of traditional style with modern comfort. Great food, tours, hikes and overall atmosphere. Wish we stayed more than 2 nights. Don't go for excitement, be prepared to hike, cook and relax in the many casual areas of the compound.
title: Wonderful hideaway in Bali mountains

text: We spent 3 nights here and loved it. The staff are friendly and polite and really go out of their way to ensure you get the best out of your stay. The massage was memorable. The accommodation is spotless and comfortable, and the food is very good. The gardens are well maintained and lovely to walk around, there are plenty of comfortable nooks and crannies for a quiet read or contemplate. Richard Kaal runs a happy ship and is very entertaining company. His love of Bali, the people and the music is very evident. Cycling downhill to the hot springs and seeing the local life was our highlight.
title: Peaceful stay

text:
Whether you are a backpacker or a 5 star hotel devotee, everyone needs to give themselves some chill out time every now and then and this is the perfect place to do it. The grounds are amazing, the rooms simple, but classy in their simplicity and the fresh wholesome food is delicious. You order in the morning, so the ingredients for your lunch and evening meal are sourced that day - it doesn't get much fresher that this!  
I stayed for 4 days and found there to be plenty of variety and tried different meals each time.  I only ate Indonesian but there were many choices for Western food also.  There was a lovely little massage hut and I had an awesome massage one day - "just a soft one please!".  There were many areas in the grounds to sit around and read, or just enjoy the vista.
There are walks, tours and workshops you can do, if you so desire and a good place to explore for kids. There are some steps and ponds, but if you watch younger children they would be fine. (same as anywhere really)
Richard is a very welcoming host and nothing was too much trouble.  The staff were sweet and unobtrusively went about their business keeping everything ship shape.  There are 3 new rooms under construction, ready next year - one an interconnecting room that will suit a family.
From my initial emails to the airport pickup and my whole stay - efficiency was the practice.
I recommend to use the BMR driver, as they are used to the drive and will not grizzle about the bumpy road.  And yes the road is bumpy, but no worse than a corrugated West Australian road up north.  It is seriously not an issue.
I found the rates to be really reasonable, even as a solo traveller.
So, do yourself a favour, grab a book and head for the mountains!
title: Stunning!

photos.caption: Main Teakhouse - 6 guest rooms housed within

text: By far my favourite experience of being in Bali. Thick luscious rainforest, great friendly staff and not packed with drunken tourists. The food is fantastic. After a couple of days up this mountain you will feel completely renewed!
title: So Good!

text:
BMR is located up in the mountains and offers a cool, refreshing spot to hang out.  The rooms are comfortable and the evenings peaceful with no TV.  The food is ok and being isolated the only option for eating is at BMR itself.  I did find as a vegetarian that the menu was a little limited but meat eaters should do okay!  I was a little discouraged that we had to choose our evening dinner at the beginning of the day & the staff seemed put out when we didn't want to order lunch.
These are minor things though.
The 2 hr stone massage is a must and the massage hut is a very nice place to hang out.
The journey from the airport to BMR took a long time, so I would recommend staying for more than one night.
title: A pleasant stay although a little pricey.

owner_response.text:
Thanks very much for your review.  We are working on new items on the menu list right now and try to offer local, fresh ,produce on any given day.  Depending on what you would like to eat for lunch and dinner, the chefs go shopping for fresh ingredients as we are very isolated in the mountains.  As everywhere in Bali you can sometimes be misunderstood by the staff as their English is not perfect but we do try to make sure our staff are friendly and helpful at all times. If there is a next time, try to stay longer than one night and you will experience the magic of the mountain and the retreat…..
Rani
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: My first time to Bali and I wanted to go up into the mountains and connect with the real spirit of Bali.  At BMR I found it!  Within a traditional Balinese enclosure I found lovely gardens and beautifully designed accommodation.  The pace is slow and relaxing with amazing food to be enjoyed overlooking the hillside and plateau far below. The owner Richard and his staff were very helpful and went out of their way to enrich my experience. Walking through the garden forest to a Hindu temple where we were traditionally blessed by the priest was an amazing experience!  Thank you Indra for guiding me there. I will definitely be back on my next visit to Bali.
title: The real Bali

text:
This is a lovely retreat in beautiful surroundings. If you are looking for peace and quiet, and wonderful food, this place is for you.  We were 4 weeks into our trip and seeking more activity when we arrived here, so it felt a little slow to us.  Very few guests at the time.  We did take a mountain bike tour with one of the guides recommended by the hotel and that was fabulous.  This is a part of Bali not yet overly touristed, so it had a very nice feel.
There are no public transportation options withing striking distance.  If you are on a budget, this makes it difficult.  One must have their own car rental or car and driver, which makes it a more expensive option.  Communication with the owner is a dream.  He is very responsive.
title: Beautiful surroundings, difficult to get to

text: We stayed at BMR for 3 wonderful nights. The owner and his staff all welcomed us with smiles and helpfulness every second of the day. The property is stunning and well maintained. The photos online don't do it justice. Getting to the local hiking trails, villages and temples we're easy. The jungle hike was a good trek for the intermediate to advanced hiker. We decided to venture on our own, but they also offer local tour guides to take you around. If we could have stayed longer we would have taken advantage of their tours and massages. They offer accomodation for those wanting more luxiourous rooms to the budget traveller. Being that we are on a long trip, we opted for the Bale Gede at $35/night. It was like a villa with sliding windows, so spacious and comfy. Perfect to open and listen to the rain on our final night. The food was delicious and full of flavor.  They also have lots of outdoor lounging spots, which we fully took advantage of! This place is a must for those traveling to Bali! We will be back!
title: BMR is luxury set in the lush peaceful Bali mountains at an affordable price.

text: Nice place in the montain of Bali, calm and quiet, with good opportunity for trekking in the surroundings, all the good word said previously are true, but there;s couple issues that don't give me right to rate it 5 - first is overpriced and monotonous food and no options to eat somewhere else becouse it far from other restaurants or even local shops and second is thin walls between rooms so I heard our neighbors snoring at nihght and bathroom can be kept in better condition. Otherwise it's great place to stay !
title: Nice calm place in the hidden corner of Bali

text:
My partner and I absolutely fell in love with this place. Even the drive to it was amazing, I couldn't get my head out of the window!!

Once there we fell into a easy routine of relaxation, eating and recuperating. 

Food is magnificent, as are the juices! Staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. My partner and I hiked Mt Batakaru (definitely felt a bit of pain after that one...) and our guide Putu was excellent. 

We really adored our stay here and will certainly be back.  

Thanks Richard for the amazing retreat!!
title: Fell in love

text: How amazing and spiritual this place is..high in the mountains, peace and solitude. Comfortable accomodation, magnificent food and the most wonderful staff. Thank you for the experience Richard and staff.
title: Amazing

text: Never been in a place as genuine before. Great venue up in the remote Balinese mountains, true people,  beautiful surroundings. Have not  mentioned the extraordinary staff - friendly, personal and professional - not to mention Richard, who really makes the whole experience extra special with his very own personal approach. Food is beyond good! The whole venue is truly inspirational, I'll probably regret advertising this gem as there might just not be availability in this 10 room guest house, next time we book!
title: True bali experience

text:
Lovely place, arranged with TASTE. Some kind of a mountain lodge, in the middle of cacao and coffee plantations. Great view from the restaurant, the garden is a delight.
A place that everyone shoud include in a "Bali trip schedule" !
Bonus : you will meet nice persons... Richard And Rani, your hosts.
title: Top ! Don't leave Bali without stopping by.

text: Never have I felt the need to write a review of a place before I even completed my stay!  Bali Mountain Retreat is simply fantastic, from the subtle nuances of excellent background music to the intricate designs of each and every dwelling.  I am endlessly fascinated by the pathways and stepping stones between abodes, and seem to have a hard time straying far as there always seem to be couches or lounges yawning empty and patiently awaiting my presence.  Richard has created something softly spectacular here and I am excited to see what the future holds as far as music-focused gatherings and the mountain retreat becoming a mecca for music lovers worldwide.  The food is delectable and the staff, other travellers, and even the felines who wander about are all divine company.  And if one happens to catch the invisible scent of something even more more effervescent, lingering in the damp midst around the mountain or in the rich leaves of the forest of trees...I suspect this is the true magic of the mountain, just waiting to be beheld...
title: Subime and magical

text:
we stayed here 3 nights lately and despite the awful weather all around bali we had a great time.
the service is great, the premises look fantastic and the location is magical.
on the couple of outings we made, we saw NO other tourists. Unspoilt Bali still exists.
title: fantastic service, interesting activities and unspoilt location

text:
Richard explained to us by email that the road to the Retreat was not easy to take for an unfamiliar driver but he then told us where to download helpful maps and instructions.  The landscape up to the Retreat was really interesting but the road was very rough. Richard's drivers take a smoother journey there so it is worthwhile organizing this in our opinion.
Once at the Retreat we totally relaxed in the beautiful environment.  Richard is a wonderful host, helpful and gracious.  He is obviously a very creative person with vision who has turned the property into one full of character.
Our room had everything we could wish for including a delightful outside shower.  The restaurant food was delicious and his staff well trained.
We took lots of walks through the forest area surrounding the retreat.
We were delighted with our stay and hope to get back to Richard's hideaway again in the future.
title: Unexpected delight

text:
This place is a little oasis surrounded by a few villages, rice fields and temples. If you like peace and quiet or walking through natural areas, national parks and mountains then this is a great place to stay. 
Richard and his wife Rebecca are very friendly and easy going people ready to give great advice about what to do in the area. The rooms are well finished and overlook beautiful garden areas that slope down the valley. 
Our three young boys loved playing with the local boys and girls and enjoyed the guided walk through the rice fields to the river. Our guide (Giday) taught the boys about the plants of the area and which fruits they could eat. They loved the nectar from the flowers and the freshly picked  'snakeskin' fruit.
There was nothing that Richard would not do to make our stay perfect. Richard even organized to have our luggage dropped off to our hotel in Kuta while we took a boat to the Gili islands.
I would go back again as it is one of those places where you are made to feel at home.

Thanks Richard, You made it a special holiday.

PS: bring a jacket as it is a little cooler at night when compared to the coast.
title: Its the Real Side of Bali

text:
I did not know what to expect upon arrival to the Bali Mountain Retreat. Having not experienced the wonders of Bali ever before in my short life, and extremely keen to do so. I was totally open to letting Rich, owner of the retreat, stick me on the back of his motorbike and take me on the wild, rocky journey up the mountain. 

What an exhilarating experience- the journey itself. We rode through tiny Balinese villages and stopped at some locals markets where, apart from me, there was not a tourist in sight. This was the real Bali. We arrived at the retreat after dark. Although I couldn't see the wonderful gardens and views so well, the place had an immediate serene, magical air- away from bustling Melbourne, I resonated with the relaxed vibe and let my senses go. Rich was an absolute gem from the first meeting, I now call him my 'Enigma' for not only has he built an amazing retreat, a total escape from the tourist centers of Kuta and Seminyak, but he also works hard in preserving traditional Balinese music, though field recordings which he presents on his own website. His extreme love for the Balinese culture and his knowledge for their traditions is apparent, and he is always happy to educate his guests of the true Balinese lifestyle. 

The food at the retreat is sensational, always using fresh ingredients and cooked with love. I became particularly fond of the pancakes for breakfast, which, served with delicious palm sugar syrup, were hands down the best I've had! For dinner, we ate mainly curries and noodles, all flavored with unusual but incredible spices I'd never experienced before. And the coffee.. Wow. It's STRONG! Amazingly so. I was buzzing before I finished one cup!

The retreat, visually, is stunning. Beautifully landscaped gardens, but not 'overdone' or tacky like many resorts/hotels. The rooms each have their own characteristics and charm. I stayed at the retreat twice during my stay in Bali (I couldn't stay away!) and in both the superior teak house room and the traditional Bale Gede. Both were beautifully furnished and comfortable. The teak house room had the biggest bed i've ever seen.. I slept very well! Also, the retreat is incredibly quiet at night time.. A few exotic insect calls every now and then, which added to the serene atmosphere. I really felt I was worlds away from the hectic tourist scene.

The staff at the retreat were beautiful, kind and welcoming and really made an effort to provide professional services whilst retaining the relaxed, chilled vibe of the retreat. Lucy, the in-house masseuse, is both graceful and  efficacious at her craft- I had two massages and they were both sensational, and left me feeling clear, soothed and quite dreamy! I spent a lot of time with Rich, his beautiful wife Rani, and their little munchkin Luna. As a total stranger to them at the beginning, saying good bye was very hard as they really felt like family, and the retreat being my home away from home. I've never stayed at a hotel/resort/lodgings that has had that effect on me. It was, in a way, a very surreal experience in that I had escaped my crazy, full-on Melbourne lifestyle, which is my life, and arrived at the retreat to really find myself, clear my head and experience true serenity. Mind- blowing, for sure. 

I recommend the retreat to absolutely anyone and everyone who is looking for a different experience of Bali, to relax and reconnect with nature but most importantly to reconnect with yourself. I wish to thank everyone at retreat for my time. I'll be seeing you soon, no doubt. 

Claire Powell
title: A mind-blowing, magical place

text: Wanting to get away from the tourist hubbub, then this is a place I can heartily recommend. The road to Bali Mountain Retreat is an adventure. Once you turn off the main road you are in old Bali. The road up the mountain is long and easy to get lost on so a driver is a good idea if your Indonesian is not good. (They will arrange a pickup for you). We arrived late for lunch but no worries, an excellent nasi campur lunch was prepared. The food is excellent. The cook can cook and everything we ate would be a credit to a top restaurant. The location is wonderful. Set in immaculate gardens, small joglo are placed to allow you to sit quietly and meditate. Great for group retreats. If you give yourself time there are walks through the country where you will see Bali Asli (real Bali). Anyone who tells you that Bali has been ruined by tourism should be taken here. i got lost on the way home and that turned into another adventure. The people were lovely. Our car got bogged at the end of a road to nowhere and shortly people appeared from what seemed like uninhabited landscape and set us back on track. As a result of taking the wrong road we experiences rice terraces as beautiful as any I have seen, villages that could have come from 100 years ago and wonderful people.
title: Want to experience Bali as it was?? Try Bali mountain retreat. Top experience!!!

photos.caption: Rice fields on the way home

text:
I had a truly wonderful time here. Richard was extremely welcoming and the staff were friendly, polite and respectful. The food was absolutely outstanding and I'm only sorry I didn't realise there was a cookery course available. All the salads were lovely- so fresh. The chicken curries were all unique and interesting and I wish I knew how to cook it all!

I went on the temple walk with Denung, who works at BMR. The walk was lovely but the company was exquisite. What a lovely girl. 

I was sad to leave but if I ever go back to Bali in the future I will certainly go back to BMR. I really loved it there.
title: Really wonderful, my own personal rehab session

text: We stayed in the Bali Mountain Retreat for four days and never get bored. I relaxed doing yoga early in the morning in the perfect quiet of the nature (apart from the roosters). Our room, the Lotus House, were perfect for our needs, as we were a couple with a friend and we had privacy enough for all of us. My son and his sweetheart stayed in a Rice House, very romantic but quite hot, my son told me. We want to thank Richard, a very nice man who seems to have understood much about life, who spent his time with us advising about the most remarkable places to visit in Bali. We had a fantastic trip on the pristine Mount Batukaru and an exhilarating trip on mountain bike amidst the rice fields. My friend Grazia recommends the hot stone massage!
title: thanks, Richard!

text: Tucked away under the silently watchful eye of the Batukaru (?) mountain lies this deeply peaceful Bali Mountain Retreat. During my 4 days there it felt as though the Land itself exuded an energy that entered my soul. Richard Kaal seems to have collaborated closely with the Land, whilst creating and constructing the buildings and gardens.They do not intrude on the landscape at all, as one so often sees in 'developments', but rather they are 'supported' by it. There are various excursions and 'sights' one can plan and book, but I would suggest to just BE there and let the Land show you how "not-to-DO" for a few days!!!  Richard, his family and lovingly attentive staff made my stay very special and I wish I could go straight back there tomorrow. (Marianne, Perth Western Australia)
title: No need for 'doing .... Just Being!

text: I want to return to Bali Mountain Retreat immediately! It is truly a gem in Central Bali—a haven amidst the crowded tourist destinations and slightly off the beaten path. I was looking for a place where I could be close to Nature, experience some serenity, and possibly work on some creative projects. I got all this and more. I also learned about the people of Bali, the traditions, language, culture, history, and ways in which we can relate to and preserve our environment. I ate incredibly healthy and delicious organic meals looking out over the clouds and treetops. I found amazing friends in the other guests, the staff, and the wonderful family that runs the Retreat. It is not fancy here, even though it is clean, beautiful, and accommodating. It is not bustling with activity, and yet there is plenty to do. What BMR is, is truly special. If you want to enter into Paradise with an open mind and an open spirit, then I am sure you will be welcomed to Bali Mountain Retreat with open arms. Trust me, you will leave with a happy heart.
title: Paradise in the Sky

text: We had 3 nights at BMR as part of 10 nights in Bali (3 on beach at Tanjunsari Hotel in Sanur, 4 at Arma Hotel in Ubud--3 would have been ok-- two lovely higher-end hotels offering great value).  I visited Bali in 1971-- all of Bali has retained its culture wonderfully despite being much more prosperous and crowded--but BMR offers the "old Bali" with great comfort and intimacy.  The rooms are comfortable, full-service, food very nice, everything works, and the people very nice, including owner Richard who is a true expert in traditional music. The setting is gorgeous beyond description, and cool at night (no AC needed). Their trips were great:  a 6-hour private hike in rainforest and farmland, a one-hr cooking class, and a one-day private excursion through the region seeing temples and lunch on the beach at Lovina.  Very reasonable price.  Terrific for fit adults and teens. Only drawback is the lovely but long drive with their driver-- over 2 hours from Denpassar-- so plan to stay 3 nights. Planning advice: 2-3 night Sanur, 2-3 Ubud, 3 BMR, maybe 2 on far west coast.
title: May 2012 3 nights great

text:
I originally booked just 3 nights at Bali Mountain Retreat but ended up staying 7 nights. It is a beautiful property in a magical setting. Set in the mountain amidst rainforest and rice paddies it's a world away from the heat and bustle and the commercialism of the main tourist areas. 

There is a good range of rooms to suit different budgets but regardless of which room you choose, the location and setting make it a 5-star experience. I actually found that some of the smaller, more basic rooms had more charm.

If travelling solo it is easy to mix with others or to be on your own depending on your mood.

I highly recommend this place to those looking to experience another side of Bali.
title: There is something special about this place

text:
I cannot speak highly enough of our stay at the Bali Mountain Retreat. The accomodation, staff, host and location left nothing to be desired. 
Situated high above the hustle and bustle the BMR has a wonderful serenity about it (whether you meditate or not the whole place is amazingly peaceful and relaxing.)
Spending some time with your favourite book and a delicious cinnamon and honey coffee up in the Bird's Nest lookout is a memory you will never forget.
We also took a guided walk through the jungle/gardens to a local temple. Sampling a variety of fruits along the way and getting an insight into a local's life in the area from our guide. 
The meals and accomodation at BMR were some of the best we had during our trip. 
I would not hesitate recommending the BMR to anyone looking for a taste of a less touristy Bali.
title: Bali Heaven

text: We spent two nights at BMR at the end of March, 2012 and really enjoyed our stay.  The biggest compliment I can give is my two teenagers didn't want to leave.  Richard has done a lovely job with the buildings and the surrounding countryside is beautiful.  If you are looking for quiet, to disconnect from everyday life, and to hike some beautiful mountains, this is the place for you.  And the ginger tea was fabulous!  Thanks for a great stay--we'll be back!
title: Even the teens loved it!

text: We had a very memorable new years at BMR watching traditional dancing by girls from the local village and a performance by Richard (the owner) who is an impressive musician. BMR is a great base from which to do jungle treks and we especially enjoyed the rice fields walk with Gede. We hope to be back and plan on staying longer this time!
title: A beautiful place

text: No tourists, no crazy traffic, just a beautiful pristeen place in a quiet village. A true retreat to get away from the hustle and bustle of the touristy areas of Bali.  Magnificent  views and gorgeous places to hike to. Service is friendly and unabtrusive. This is a perfect place to fall on love with Bali.
title: Sublime retreat on the mountain.

text:
My wife and I stayed here for four nights in February, 2012 based on the recommendation of a friend.  We loved it.  First, it's in the mountain highlands where the temperature is very comfortable day and night, which makes for a pleasant stay.  The scenery and colours are terrific.  We stayed in the superior teak room (below the yoga studio) which was spacious, clean, well appointed and very comfortable.  The partial open-air bathroom was a delight.
Owner/manager Richard Kaal is amiable, laid-back, helpful, a wealth of information about Baliand a delightful host. His staff have been well-trained and provide excellent, friendly service.  Be sure to have a massage in the wonderful hut dedicated to that purpose; the woman providing the massage is excellent at her craft, one of the best massages we had in Bali (and we had many, including at five-stars in Nusa Dua).
Meals are individually prepared from scratch and delicious.
The place is quite isolated, which is part of its attraction, and, as others have noted, reached over a bumpy, crumbling road, which also adds to the adventure.  We hiked in pouring rain in the nearby national park to the second temple and enjoyed this moderately difficult walk.
Highly recommend this small resort.
title: Great recommendation

text:
If you like going out of the ordinary and want to see more than Bali's tourism-places, go there!!
Wow, what an experience this was...the trip up the mountain was rocky and bumpy but the transport was arranged by BMR so we had an experienced driver, felt fine and safe. You really go off-roads through little villages, amazing to see. And then you walk in BMR...beautifully built with wood and bamboo and a lot of nature's green. We had a very warm and friendly welcome and right after we settled in, we immediately felt the power of this place: total peace and quiet. There is no city around to explore, no shops, etc. We had no 'extractions' so after travelling around Bali for 2 weeks, for the first time we felt like coming down to earth. With just yourself and the nature around you. Now I am not the yoga-meditation-type of person but this felt spiritual! When the night came we had dinner in the restaurant overlooking the jungle and the lights of the city's far away. It was the best food we had in Bali! They could have made it more expensive since this is your only option to eat but it is as cheap as the rest of Bali. 
The music of the owner Richard was playing in the background (good music!), we were the only people there so we just stared away and everything was magical.
If you're a little bit scared of the jungle with all the darkness and animal-sounds (we are..haha!) then I would recommend the rooms with your own bathroom 'indoors'. If you're not, you can have you're pick in more primitive (and cheaper) options. 
I never met Richard, but he went out of his way to get me the right cd (I bought one of his cd's but later on it turned out to be another one that I had heared). I already left BMR and he got me the right cd for free, delivered in the place I was staying later. So nice of him!
We only stayed for one night but I can imagine even more magical and spiritual moments will come to you if you stay longer. Go there!!
title: Go there!

text: A well-appointed, peaceful spot with great service and surroundings.  Highly recommended if you want to get away from all the noise and crowds.  The helpful, friendly staff go out of their way to ensure that you enjoy your stay.
title: A the name indicates, great place to retreat.

text:
After a two hours trip with the optional pickup service from Kuta to BMR I found myself in this little peaceful camp. Sure, the drive to this elevated area could be better if the infrastructure wouldve been improved, but hey this is Bali, and BMR is a remote place.

When I arrived at BMR I was introduced to everyone who was employed. Richard and his family are very kind and open-minded people. Same are his employees. There was no time when they could not take care of you wishes, for me such as laundry service, temple trips, tour to the north coast by car, and of course breakfast, lunch etc. 

For that this place is a very remote point, the variations of meals, drinks and activities were outstanding. Within my 25 days trip on Bali I did not experience any better service than I found in BMR. For me BMR is the most authentic Bali Inland experience, whether you go for a guided two hour walk within the beautiful nature, where the guide is showing you flora and fauna, picking up fruits and tasting and feeling its unique culture or wander about alone in the jungle. Or if you like to relax and stay in the camp, you will always feel welcome to get a homemade Bali coffee and a quiet place to read a book or take a nap.

For everyone who fancies a time off the loud and overcrowded places like Kuta or Ubud I would abundantly recommend the BMR. Since this is a place in the middle of the island, you better get earplugs when you have a light sleep. I have got used to it after my third night. But in total, its a worthy experience one should not miss when being on Bali. 
Feel free to contact me for furhter informations.
title: Impressions of an Island Getaway

text: We were tired of scratching around like chickens amidst the chaos, heat and grime of lowland Bali, so we left Kuta for the mountains and found a gem of a spot. Bali Mountain Retreat lies on what must be the last pristine forested mountain left on the whole island, and offers a taste of what Bali must have been like in the 1950's or something. It is like another world up there and we both found it hard to believe there still exists such a quiet, serene and wild place hidden away on such a small heavily populated island. The views are astounding and I have never found a better place for meditation. The cafe views are tooooo good, and i always ate more courses than I should have, but the food is superb and I could not drag myself away from the views. We stayed for ten days and I ended up participating in a music retreat and wrote two songs whilst there. The proprietor, Richard is a great fellow and will look after your every need. The Balinese locals way up there on the mountain are soooo friendly, and I even had the opportunity to see a traditional Balian (healer) there for a healing for a long term minor eye ailment I had been carrying for many months. The healing involved what westerners might regard as a magical and well as more mundane, prosaic therapeutic interventions. I think my eye is feeling a bit better, but time will tell if my visit to the shaman fixed the problem. None-the-less it was a magical and enchanted encounter with a very traditional Balinese healer. Finally I have found a place where that traditional Balinese feel still endures, and whose staff are actually willing to take a bit of time out to teach you about their culture. We climbed the cacao trees with the locals at the retreat and i got to harvest and prepare my own wild crafted chocolate! The highlight for me though, apart from the music retreat which i thoroughly recommend if you go at the right time of year, is the serenity, quiet and the friendliness of the local staff, and their willingness to actually help you connect with the locals there. If you are lucky enough to go to Bali Mountain Retreat say hi to Richard and Rani and all the crew up there where the eagles fly, and tell them "chocolate fiend Robert will be back sooner than two shakes of a lamb's tail.
title: Where eagles fly

text:
Bali Mountain Retreat offers a haven of peace and beauty. After travelling the steep & deteriorating roads to get there you really feel like you're away from the bustle of regular life.
The setting is amongst lush tropical gardens; beautiful stone pathways connecting the buildings.  
The rooms are simple and clean & tastefully decorated, ranging from secluded honeymoon style, own bathroom, to a traditional rice house for those looking for a budget experience.
One of my favourite places to while away an afternoon is what was called the "Birds nest", a small, open style room set at the top of a staircase, with a perfect view of the valley all the way down to Denpasar. At night the lights of the city look magical, and sunrise is spectacular. 
Extremely friendly staff are always cheerful and willing to help at any time. 
And to top off this perfect retreat setting, the food is absolutely fabulous!
Although a little out of the way, Bali Mountain Retreat is well worth a visit for those searching for a peaceful Balinese experience.
title: A perfect retreat providing a peaceful and very beautiful environment to recharge.

text: We spent a glorious 3 nights at Bali Mountain Retreat and loved every minute of it. The host Richard has everything organised beautifully but still with a wonderful sense of relaxation. The rooms were clean and fresh,we had our own en-suite with shower. There is plenty to do as Mt Batukaru is close by. One can take a walk for half an hour an hour or all day. However long you like. If you want to take a walk to the top of the mountain (sacred to the Balinese people I believe) Richard can arrange a guide if needed. Or if you want to just chill out and do absolutely nothing this is the perfect place.Quiet and serene.There is a masseuse on hand for those wanting to really relax with a Bali style massage.The staff are friendly and the food is gorgeous with plenty of variety with a mixture of Balinese and western style meals.And there is always some other interesting traveler to talk to.Richard is always available to suggest things to do or arrange transport.This fabulous place was the highlight of our Bali trip and we wouldn't hesitate to give it the highest recommendation.
title: A taste of the real Bali

text:
Wow! I just enjoyed my 4th blissful stay at Bali Mountain Retreat, and for me it truly gets better every time. As this has long been my favourite get-away spot in Bali, I figured it was high time to contribute another review. This place is PERFECT for anyone wanting to truly escape the 'mainstream mayhem' of the common tourist scene in Bali. If you are aiming for a deeper experience of nature, inner and external tranquility, soaking up one of the most traditional regions of the island, whilst enjoying refreshingly warm and personal - tasteful - hospitality... you're on the right track!   
     Entering the foothills of Mt. Batukau, above the bustling town of Tabanan...well, I didn't know what to expect the first time. After an exhilarating drive out of the chaos, up the winding, increasingly rugged road, to arrive at....BLISSFUL, intimate Bali Mountain Retreat. BMR host, Richard, is a gem; warm without pretense, immediately exuding the peaceful calm, normally associated with Balinese locals. This time I stayed in one of the Superior Teak House rooms - exquisite and spacious. Flower-folded towels, fresh mountain water, very comfortable bed, immediate hot mountain water. A stroll down to the retreat cafe offers an incredible view, and I often spend evenings gazing all the way to the coast from the vantage point of the Bird's Nest, directly above the cafe. The spacious, respectfully social restaurant also enjoys tree-top views, and the food is some of the nicest, non-pretentious cuisine I have experienced in Bali.  
   The high forests of Mt Batukaru always call to me when I stay at Bali Mountain Retreat, so I make it a point to get out for daily hikes to higher ground - so refreshing, and the local villagers are always generous with welcoming free smiles.  
    The in-house masseur, Lusi, is very gifted, offering personal treatments that stand out above the usual tourist treatments at standard venues in Ubud, Seminyak, Kuta, and Sanur. 
     The strongest sensation I consistently experience at Bali Mountain Retreat is one of INSPIRATION.  Thank you, Richard and Rani (Richard's lovely, hospitable wife).  I love the natural, often musical environment you genrously share - and of course, as you already know -- I'll be back!
title: Bali Mountain Bliss!

text: Beautiful, tranquil and peaceful, the perfect place to have a retreat, especially if you want to be pampered while having it!!  The reality of the experience was better than our imagination.  We were met and entertained by our host Richard until our group arrived.  It was like meeting an old friend and I noticed that this was the same for all guests.  It was so friendly, it was easy to chat to other guests.  The food was fresh organic and delicious and plenty of it.  Any request was met with a smile and appeared within minutes.  The accomodation was spotlessly clean, comfortable and charming.  The staff were wonderful, very sweet and professional but it felt like we were looked after by a loving family.  The accomodation for the retreat was spacious and airy.  Although this was the 'rainy season' and we did have some magnificent storms; it only added to the enjoyment and it was cool, very little humidity, then the sun shone and the whole landscape lit up.  We could see all the way to Kuta!  For a beautiful restful holiday or retreat I would highly recommend the Bali Mountain Retreat, you will be as thrilled as we were, it was the highlight of our Bali visit.
title: Perfect Place to have a Retreat

text: Upon our arrival at Bali Mountain Retreat, we immediately felt the serenity of what was going to be home for the next 3 days. We loved every second of those three days spent there.
